loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is an old client of Ugafode Microfinance who has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX. She runs a small shop selling ladies clothing in Mbarara and has been doing this for more than five years. The purpose of the loan is to restock her business during this season when she anticipates sales will be high.  Therefore, she can increase on her earnings to adequately meet her family's needs and pay tuition for her siblings in addition to developing herself.  Edith is an honest and very hard working woman but is always limited by capital. She thinks this will soon be history with a financial boost from Ugafode.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Zakariya

texts.en: Zakariya is a maize farmer from the Nassarawa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Zakariya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Zakariya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Zakariya, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jafaru

texts.en: Jafaru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Jafaru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Shamsu, Maryam and Zainab.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Jafaru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Jafaru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Jafaru  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for childrens' school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ivan De Jesus

texts.es:
Ivan, de 62 años, inicio con su oficio de construcción y reformas de viviendas en el municipio de Marinilla, negocio que inicio con el afán de sostener a sus 8 hijos y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.
En el momento en que nació su último hijo, encontró su motivación para trabajar incansablemente y así ofrecerle lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.
Hoy en día su hijo menor tiene 23 años y se ha convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de herramientas de trabajo pesado como sierra circular y pulidora para mejorar y optimizar su trabajo.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener a sus hijos y a su esposa brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor y una optima estabilidad económica.

Apoya a Ivan con un préstamo para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Ivan, 62 years old, started his job in construction and housing reforms in the municipality of Marinilla, a business he started with the eagerness to sustain his 8 children and offer them a better quality of life.
When his last son was born, he found the motivation to work tirelessly and as such offer him the best for his life and development.
Today his youngest son is 23 years old and has turned into the happiness of this hardworking man.

He requests a loan to buy heavy duty tools like a circular saw and a polisher to improve and optimize his work.

With this loan he will be able to sustain his children and his wife and offer them a better quality of life and an optimal economic stability.

Help Ivan with a loan so that he can continue his activity!

loans.use: to buy heavy duty tools like a circular saw and a polisher

loans.name: Jorge Humberto

texts.es:
Jorge, cultiva granos básicos, cría y comercializa cerdos, está acompañado, vive con su pareja y un hijo, tiene la responsabilidad de trabajar muy duro para sacar a su familia adelante, de manera independiente trabaja hace 6 años, tiene un horario de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, sus ventajas y desventajas dependen mucho de las condiciones climáticas.
Utilizará el capital para pagar los gastos de recolección de la cosecha además comprará cerdos y concentrado, dará mejores cuidados a los animales y tendrá su cosecha a tiempo para alimentar a su familia y hacer las entregas a sus clientes.
Jorge aspira a tener un negocio más rentable, cancelar su deuda y ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge grows basic grains and raises and sells pigs. He lives with his partner and child and is responsible for the family. He works very hard to help his family move forward. He has been working independently for 6 years. He works between seven in the morning to three in the afternoon. The success of his business is very dependent on the climate.  

He will use the loan to pay the costs of harvesting his grains, to buy pigs and concentrate feed as well as providing better care for his animals. The loan will allow him to produce his harvest on time, to feed his family and satisfy client demands.

Jorge aspires to have a more profitable business, to pay off his debt and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrate feed as well as providing better care for his animals. The loan will allow him to produce his harvest on time to feed his family and satisfy client demands.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe DANAYA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à Macourani un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame  Aminata  accise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo fait le commerce de condiments dans ce groupe. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  5 paquets de 30 unités de cube Maggi, 10 kg d’oignon 2 kg de l’échalote. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché. Sollicitée par sa clientèle composée principalement de femme à travers  la qualité de ses produits, elle fait ces ventes au comptant ainsi qu’à crédit chez elle et au marché. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt ainsi que  son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Danaya group are married women who, on average, are 35 years old and have three children. They mostly live in traditional families in Macourani, one of the popular areas of the town of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. The group is on their first group loan with Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their customers' needs.

Aminata, who is seated on the far left in the photo, works selling condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy five packages of 30 units of Maggi cubes, 10 kilograms of onions, and two kilograms of shallots. She procures these goods at the large market. 

Sought by mostly women customers because of the quality of her products, she makes her sales for cash and for credit from her home and at the market. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs, of which a part will be used to pay back the loan and its interest and a part will be put in savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 04 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à Ouayerma I  un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  Salimata fait le commerce  de l’encens dans ce groupe Benkadi. Elle est  à la première position de la  gauche  vers  la droite sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  20 kg de guéni, 10 litre du parfum (eau de toilette) qu’elle transforme en l’encens. La revente est faite au marché à une clientèle composée d’ hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The four members of the Benkadi group are married women who, on average, are 35 years old and have four children. They mostly live in traditional families in Ouayerma I, one of the popular areas in the town of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their fourth group loan with Soro Yiriwason in order to meet their customers' needs.

Salimata works selling incense. She is standing first from the left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy 20 kilograms of guéni [a fragrant root] and 10 liters of perfume (eau de toilette) which will be used to make incense. Sales are made at the market to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Salimata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA, of which a part will be used to pay back the loan and its interest and a part will be put in savings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make incense

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe CONFIANCE sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à Ouayerma I  un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme Afouchata fait le commerce  de l’encens dans ce groupe. Elle est  à la première position de la  gauche  vers  la droite sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter également avec son prêt  20 kg de guéni, 10 litre du parfum (eau de toilette) qu’elle transforme en l’encens. La revente est faite au marché à une clientèle composée d’ hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37 500 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The four members of the Confiance group are married women who, on average, are 38 years old and have four children. They live mostly in traditional families in Ouayerma I, one of the popular areas in the town of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their fourth group loan with Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their customers' needs.

Afouchata works selling incense. She is standing first on the left in the photo. She plans to use her loan to buy 20 kilograms of guéni [a fragrant root] and 10 liters of perfume (eau de toilette), which she will make into incense. 

Sales are made at the market to male and female customers for cash and credit. Afouchata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 37,500 francs CFA, of which a part will be used to pay back the loan and its interest and a part will be put in savings.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients to make incense

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 29 years old and married with a two-year-old child. He is a farmer and has been farming for eight years. With this loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for his maize crop. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for maize.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 33 years old and married with two children, aged five and eight years, both of whom go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 19 years. With this loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for his maize crop. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Améyo une femme de 34ans  a pour mari un Directeur d'école. Ils ont en charge 03 enfants de 10,05 et 02ans.  Elle est coiffeuse de profession et revend aussi à la devanture de sa maison du dégué préparé à base de lait, et du couscous ou du mil. Pour renforcer son activité, elle demande un premier crédit pour acheter des matières premières(lait, sucre, mil). Elle souhaite à l'avenir agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Améyo is 34 years old and married to a school principal. They have three children aged ten, five and two. 

Améyo is a hairdresser by trade, and also sells dégué, a sweet or savoury dish made using milk and couscous or millet, from the front of her house.

She is requesting her first loan to buy ingredients (milk, sugar and millet). In the future she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy millet, couscous and sugar.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusuf would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after the harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

However, with this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher prices than the market price at harvest. When asked about his goals, Yusuf expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide his family with food and clothing and, in the long run, become the most profitable farmer in his community.

This Kiva loan will be used to provide the borrower with cash to pay for everyday expenditures until he receives income from the harvest. This financial support will enable him to wait to sell his crops until the price is highest, increasing his income significantly.

loans.use: to pay for everyday expenditures until he receives income from the harvest, enabling him to wait to sell his crops until the price is highest, increasing his income significantly.

loans.name: Maitala

texts.en: Maitala is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Maitala joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Bala and Rahila.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Maitala would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Maitala spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepay for Haiti's first solar-powered micro-grid, which will enable him to get reliable and sustainably sourced electricity in his home.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling commodities such as eggs, cooking oil, powdered milk, canned goods and toiletries. He is a married man with seven children, aged between sixteen and two. Together with his family, he lives in Mcarthur, Leyte, in the Philippines. Aside from running his store, he also goes farming to augment his income.

Edwin is asking for a loan so he can buy additional stocks for the store, like canned goods, noodles, soft drink, beverages and toiletries. These stocks will be very helpful in attracting more customers. He will be able to increase sales and improve his income. Thus, he will be able to provide a proper diet to his whole family.

Edwin hopes to improve his income to be productive and also to support the education of his children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for his store

loans.name: Hava

texts.en:
A loan in an amount of 110,000 ALL will enable Hava to pay for the couple's retirement contribution.

Hava is in her late 50s and she is married. She was photographed with her husband Engjell ("Angel" in English). They live in the southeastern part of the country and are parents of three children. To earn a living, they farm beans, fodder and onions, which they plant/harvest and sell in large quantities. Their younger two sons, who still live with them, do construction work for pay. 

The village has a very cold climate so the villagers plant mostly beans, fodder, wheat and corn and also fruit trees for cherries, plums, apples and pears; as for animals, they prefer to keep cows and sheep. Their traditional food is cooked beans.

loans.use: to pay for the couple's retirement contribution.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto, con el financiamiento anterior surtió el inventario de la venta de  calzado, CDS y DVDS, teniendo como resultado mejores ingresos, clientes nuevos, menos deudas y la satisfacción de dar a su familia un estilo de vida mejor. 
Se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para comprar CDS, DVDS, zapatos, chancletas y sandalias, para atender mejor las solicitudes de sus clientes y seguir trabajando para tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Roberto used the previous loan to buy shoes, CDs and DVDs. This resulted in a higher income, new customers, less debt and the satisfaction of being able to improve his family’s living conditions.

He decided to request a new loan to buy CDs, DVDs, shoes, slippers and sandals, in order to better fulfill his customers’ demands and continue working for a better future.

loans.use: to buy CDs, DVDs, shoes, slippers and sandals.

loans.name: Maria Edis

texts.es:
María, tiene como actividades económicas la venta de ropa y servicio de sastrería, su núcleo familiar está compuesto por su esposo y un hijo de 29 años de edad, ella realiza dicho negocio desde hace 20 años, lo aprendió por motivación propia y con los años ha perfeccionado sus conocimientos y cuenta con la preferencia de sus clientes.
Invertirá en la compra de prendas de vestir, ropa para cama y telas para elaborar los uniformes de escuelas con las que mantiene un contrato vigente, serán de utilidad para aprovechar la época de fin de año en la que las ventas aumentan y poder cumplir con la entrega de los uniformes. Su aspiración es tener mejores recursos económicos para salir adelante junto a su familia.
Anhela mantener su negocio con vida y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
María sells clothes and makes dresses. Her family is composed of her husband and a 29-year-old son. She has been doing this for twenty years. She learned on her own and has improved her knowledge with time. Her customers are loyal to her.

She wants to buy clothes, bed linen and fabrics to make school uniforms, since she has contracts with some schools. These things will be useful for her during this season, when sales increase. She will also be able to deliver the uniforms on time. She hopes to improve her financial situation in order to get ahead with her family. Her dream is to have a sustainable business and remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy clothes, bed linen and fabrics to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Safinah Talatu

texts.en:
Safinah Talatu is a maize farmer from the village of Kusa, which is in the state of Kaduna. 

Before she became a Babban Gona member, Safinah Talatu would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs. However, with this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Safinah Talatu can store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for prices up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Safinah Talatu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family. She hopes to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

This Kiva loan will be used to provide the borrower with cash to pay for everyday expenditures until she receives income from the harvest. This will allow her to wait to sell her crops until the price is highest, increasing her income significantly.

loans.use: to pay for everyday expenditures until she receives income from the harvest, allowing her to wait to sell her crops until the price is highest, increasing her income significantly.

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.en:
Alexandre is 47 years old. He is married with four children between 5 and 19 years old. All of them go to school. 

Alexandre is a farmer who has been farming for 17 years. With the loan from Kiva, Alexandre will buy maize fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy maize fertilizers.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Iliya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children, Agness, Amos and Samson.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya had to sell his maize for low prices soon after the harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for prices up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Iliya spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children get professional jobs.

This Kiva loan will be used to provide the borrower with cash to pay for everyday expenditures such as food and school fees until he receives income from the harvest. This will allow him to wait to sell his crops until the price is highest, increasing his income significantly.

loans.use: to pay for everyday expenditures such as food and school fees until he receives income from the harvest, allowing him to wait to sell his crops until the price is highest, increasing his income significantly.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive en casa propia con sus 03 hijos en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte del Perú. Sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora (bebida tradicional de la región), comida y cerveza, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 5 años. Cuenta con clientela fija en la zona quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El destino del crédito será para la compra de utensilios, sillas y mesas para implementar su negocio, así como para la compra de maíz para la preparación de la chicha de jora. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el producto se vende de manera diaria en la zona. Con esto Haydee espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes, aumentando de esta manera sus ingresos y logrando mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Haydee is 41 years old, a single mother, and lives in her own house with her 3 children in the district of La Matanza, Morropón province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru. The population works in agriculture, animal husbandry and raising animals.

She works selling chicha de jora (a traditional drink from the region), food, and beer, work that she has done for more than 5 years. She has regular customers in the zone who offer many good personal and work references for her. The loan will be destined to purchase utensils, chairs and tables to implement her business, and also to purchase corn to make chicha de jora. The market has good prospects due to the fact that the product is sold daily in the zone. With this, Haydee hopes to offer a better product to her customers, in this way increasing her income and managing to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase utensils, chairs and tables to implement her business, and also to purchase corn to make chicha de jora [corn alcohol].

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en: With this loan, Lindita wants to buy two baby calves and a dairy cow as well as a calf that she had previously bought on credit. She wants to establish a complex farm, which is why she is investing in cows slowly and strategically. The amount she is requesting from Kiva lenders this time is 200,000 ALL. Lindita also wants to thank her lenders for the previous help.

loans.use: to buy two baby calves and a dairy cow as well as a calf that she had previously bought on credit.

loans.name: Amassika Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Amassika vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Missira de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  6eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Soumai (la 2eme femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax dans le quartier  et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 11 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Soumai espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 40 000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle espère continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The four women of the Amassika group all live in nuclear families. They are on average 34 years old and have on average four children. They all live in the Missira neighborhood of Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They met each other through neighborhood, family, and marriage connections and from their businesses in the village. They run small clothing and food-serving businesses. With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their sixth group loan. Mrs. Soumai (second woman standing from the right in the photo) is a grand seller of pagne wax (traditions wrap-arounds) in Segou. The sales are made for cash and often for credit from home and at the market to a mixed clientele. Mrs. Soumai hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be used for the small needs of her children and equally to increase her business funds. She hopes to continue the collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy pagne wax (traditional wrap around)

loans.name: Layidou Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Layidou vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 51ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Médine de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de grains, condiment et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  9eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Hawa (la 2eme femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de grains d’haricot dans le quartier  et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de grains d’haricot à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Hawa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 45 000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle espère continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The five women of the Layidou group all live in nuclear families. They are on average 51 years old and have on average six children. They all live in the Médine neighborhood of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They met each other through neighborhood, family, and marriage connections and from their businesses in the village. They run small seed, seasoning, and food-serving businesses. With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their ninth group loan. Mrs. Hawa (second woman standing from the right in the photo) is a grand seller of bean seeds in the neighborhood and surrounding areas. She plans to use her loan to buy 4 sacks of bean seeds in Ségou. The sales are made for cash and often for credit from home and at the market to a mixed clientele. Mrs. Hawa hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be used for the small needs of her children and equally to increase her business funds. She hopes to continue the collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepay for Haiti's first solar-powered energy micro-grid.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Angoulême de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  3eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Maimouna (la 1ere femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de friperie dans le quartier  et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de friperie à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Maimouna espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 40 000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle espère continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The four women of the Benkadi group all live in nuclear families. They are on average 37 years old and have on average six children. They all live in the Angoulême neighborhood of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They met each other through neighborhood, family, and marriage connections and from their businesses in the village. They run small clothing and food-serving businesses. With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan. Mrs. Maimouna (the woman standing to the far left in the photo) is a big seller of secondhand clothing in the neighborhood and surrounding areas. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 loads of secondhand clothing in Ségou. The sales are made for cash and often for credit from home and at the market to a mixed clientele. Mrs. Maimouna hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be used for the small needs of her children and equally to increase her business funds. She hopes to continue the collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment, grains de riz et d’habillement. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Sadio (la 3eme femme assise de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment de tout genre dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de condiment de tout genre à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Sadio espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 12 500FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle espère continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The eight women of the Benkadi group all live in nuclear families. They are on average 34 years old and have on average three children. They all live in the Bagadadji neighborhood of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They met each other through neighborhood, family, and marriage connections and from their businesses in the village. They run small seasoning, rice seeds, and clothing businesses. With the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan. Mrs. Sadio (the third woman seated from the right in the photo) is a big seller of all kinds of seasonings in the Bagadadji neighborhood in Ségou and surrounding areas. She plans to use her loan to buy large quantities of all kinds of seasonings in Ségou. The sales are made for cash and often for credit from home and at the market to a mixed clientele. Mrs. Sadio hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 12,500 FCFA with this loan, which will be used for the small needs of her children and equally to increase her business funds. She hopes to continue the collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy seasonings

loans.name: Damian

texts.es:
Damian tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su mamá y sus hijos en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Los habitantes de esta zona se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería como actividad económica principal.

El se dedica a la venta de carnes en puesto de mercado y de animales vivos como gallinas, pavos, patos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio por lo que tiene clientela fija, quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado dicho préstamo para invertir en la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallos, patos, gallinas, entre otros para atender los pedidos de sus clientes, con esto Damian espera satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes incrementando su nivel de ingresos lo que le generará una mayor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Damian is 51 years old and lives with his mother and his children in the district of Zaña, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this zone work in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry as their primary economic activities. 

He works selling meat at a market stall and live animals such as hens, turkeys, and ducks among others. His business is located in his own home. He has experience in the business, so he has regular customers in the zone who offer very good personal and work references. He has asked for this loan to invest in the purchase of a greater number of animals such as chickens, ducks, and hens, among others, to fill his customers' orders. With this, Damian hopes to satisfy the tastes and needs of his customers, increasing his income level which will generate a better quality of life for him.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a larger number of animals such as chickens, ducks, hens, among others to fill his customers' orders.

loans.name: Ihtiyor

texts.ru:
Ихтиёр мужчина 35 лет , женат ,молодой отец уже пятерых детей. Окончив школу,Ихтиёр не смог поступить в ВУЗ,так как у его родителей не было средств оплатить университет.Поэтому Ихтиёр начал заниматься животноводством и земледелием.Вначале он пас стадо у соседей,получал за это деньги.Вскоре на скопившуюся сумму денег Ихтиёр смог купить себе одну корову .Он ухаживал за ней,молоко,полученное от дойки,продавал на рынке.И со временем Ихтиёр достич того,что теперь у него в стаде пятнадцать баранов и три коровы.Ихтиёр работает не покладая рук,потому что хочет обеспечить своих детей лучшей жизнью.Его старший сын помогает ему во всём.Так как у Ихтиёра большая семья ,денег не хватает ,поэтому он ещё подрабатывает рабочим в строительной бригаде.
Ихтиёр обратился в МДО Арванд за кредитом для увеличения поголовья своего стада.Он заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за доверие и финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Ihtiyor is a man of 35 years. He is married and the young father of five children already. After finishing school, Ihtiyor was not able to start university, as his parents did not have enough money to pay his tuition. Therefore Ihtiyor started working with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation. 

In the beginning Ihtiyor tended his neighbor's herd, and earned money from this. Soon he was able to purchase a cow for the amount he had saved. He cared for it, and sold milk received from it at the market. In time Ihtiyor attained what is now his heard: Five rams and three cows. 

Ihtiyor works tirelessly, because he would like to provide his children with a good life. His eldest son helps him with everything. As Ihtiyor has a large family, the money is not enough, and therefore he also works in a construction crew. 

Ihtiyor turned to "MDO Arvand" for a loan to increase the number of livestock in his herd. He thanks "MDO Arvand" in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia tiene 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su madre y su cónyuge en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como vacas, patos y gallinas, desde hace más de 03 años. Cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para su negocio así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, de esta manera aumentará sus ingresos y logrará mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Amelia is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her mother and her spouse in the district of Cayaltí, located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. She lives in a community dedicated to commerce, agriculture, and animal husbandry. 

She has worked raising and selling small animals such as cows, ducks and chickens for the past 3 years. She has very good personal and work references in the zone. The loan will be used to purchase a larger quantity of animals for her business and also to purchase balanced feed to fatten them. In this way, she will increase her income and manage to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of animals for her business and to pay for the balanced feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Doña Margarita, tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos con quienes reside en  un sector del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio para sostener a su familia. Lleva 5 años de vender cosméticos  a través de pedidos por medio de catálogos como  ser cremas, champú, desodorantes, lociones y también ropa por encargo. Sus ventas las realiza a domicilio y por pedidos. El prestamo que ha decidido solicitar es por 10,000 lempiras para pagar una factura de productos y comprar más cosmeticos y poder cubrir los pedidos de los clientes. Su plan a futuro es poner una tiendita de novedades en su casa.
texts.en: Margarita is 60 years old, a single mother, and has two children who live in a sector of the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. She has always worked in sales to support her family. For 5 years, she has been selling cosmetics, through orders from catalogs, such as creams, shampoo, deodorant, lotions, and also clothing by order. She makes her sales at home and also by order. The loan that she has decided to request is for 10,000 lempiras to pay a bill for products and to purchase more cosmetics and be able to fill her customers' orders. Her plan for he future is to establish a small novelties store in her house.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics and pay a bill for products.

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es:
Marta, actualmente tiene su núcleo familiar conformado por su esposo e hijos, su esposo desempeña el cargo de ordenanza en un Centro Escolar, sus hijos están estudiando y ella se dedica a realizar labores domésticas y a atender una tienda en la que vende productos varios para el hogar, la cual nace como idea de toda la familia para generar ingresos económicos con los que están mejorando su estilo de vida, ye tiene 3 años de poseerla y no representa dificultades en este momento.
Invertirá en gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, boquitas, huevos, pan, etc., considera que teniendo un inventario debidamente surtido aprovechara la temporada de fiestas navideñas y tendrá mayores ingresos. Espera ofrecer nuevos productos, atraer más clientes y servir de ejemplo para que otras personas decidan a establecer un negocio para superarse.
Sus aspiraciones son disminuir las carencias de su hogar, pagar con responsabilidad las cuotas de su deuda y contar con más clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Currently, Marta's nuclear family includes her husband and children. Her husband works as an assistant at a school site. Their children are studying and she works doing housework and at a store where she sells various household products. The store was the whole family's idea as a way of generating income, with which they are improving their lifestyle. She has had the store for three years and, at this time, she is not having any trouble with it. She will invest in soft drinks, juices, candies, snacks, eggs, bread, etc. 

She believes that with a properly stocked inventory, she will be able to take advantage of the holiday season and will have more income. She hopes to be able to offer new products, attract more customers, and serve as an example for other people who decide to start a business in order to excel. Her aspirations are to diminish her mortgage, pay her debt installments responsibility, and have more satisfied customers.

loans.use: to invest in soft drinks, juices, candies, snacks, eggs, bread, etc. because she believes that with a properly stocked inventory, she will be able to take advantage of the holiday season

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Джамила проживающая на районе Руми замужем и имеет троих детей. Ее муж собирает дрова и ветви сломанный деревьев. Он их собирает в одну кучку, грузить в свою грузовую машинку и продает в дальних деревнях и труднодоступных населенных пунктах. Джамила в свою очередь дома занимается животноводством. Она начала этот бизнес 5 лет назад. Джамила покупает скот и после откорма продает их с наценкой. Таким образом, она приносит в дом очень важный источник дохода. Джамила считает, что набралась достаточного опыта, чтобы расширить деятельность, то есть увеличить поголовья скотин. Так как ей не хватает определенной суммы денег для реализации покупки, Джамила обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Jamila is a resident of the J. Rumy region. She is married and has three children. Her husband collects firewood and branches from broken trees. He collects them in a pile, transports them in his car and sells them in distant villages and remote settlements. Jamila stays at home and works with livestock breeding. She started this business five years ago.

Jamila purchases livestock and after having bred them she sells them with a profit. This way she provides the household with a very important source of income. Jamila thinks that she has gotten enough experience to expand her business, e.g. to increase the number of livestock as he does not have the amount of money to make the purchase, Jamila applied for a loan.

loans.use: to increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe Djekafo  vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Bagadadji de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment, habillement et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  4eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Jeanne Tanti    (la 1ere femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiment dans le quartier  et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de condiment de tout genre à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Jeanne Tanti  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 26 000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle espère continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
