This is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to construct a wall and a gutter around his home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to construct a wall and a gutter around his home

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia comes from a family of dairy farmers and lives from selling her cows' milk. She also owns a few hogs and cultivates corn on a small plot of land. 

Prior to acquiring her biodigester, Inocencia used to spend at least one hour two days a week to find wood in the surrounding area to cook. She bought expensive fossil-fuel-based LP gas, as well as some chemical fertilizers for her field. With her biodigester, Inocencia will not only save money by displacing these two external inputs, but will also save time and improve her health, as she will eliminate the toxic smoke she used to inhale while she was cooking. Her cows' waste will be input directly into the biodigester, producing biogas to cook and heat water and a nutrient-rich fertilizer for her corn field. She will save money and her quality of life will improve at the same time. With her savings, Inocencia plans to increase her milk production capacity and start making cheese to expand the family business. In the future, she would also like to improve the stable for her animals and make more space for the purchase of additional cows.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to produce biogas to cook and heat water

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bar soap, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are the general public. 

Christine will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 30 years old. He is married to Lucy and together they have been blessed with two children.

Leonard does a money transfer business which he has operated for the last four years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 20,000. Leonard has requested  his first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 15,000 which he will use to add float of money for his "M-pesa" transfer business.

With the anticipated profits, Leonard will be able to expand his business further.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to be able to support his family.

loans.use: to add float of money for  "M-pesa" money transfer business

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is a factory worker. He is from Cavite, Philippines and he is married. He is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.*

Allan works as a Production Line Leader. He conducts inspections and tests per a control plan, work instructions, and procedures. He maintains good housekeeping at all times in his respective working area. He is also responsible for the group of operators and carries out manpower utilization effectively to meet shipments. One of the main dilemmas of employees like Allan is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Allan is asking for your assistance to prevent him from being exposed to loan sharks. He has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and he had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is deducted every pay day. He looks forward for your positive response and any assistance from you will surely be of great help. He will use the loan to pay his debts and also meet personal needs.

Allan wants to have a stable source of income so he can meet his family's daily needs and expenses.  He wants to give his family a better life someday. He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring, and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay his debts and also meet personal needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cream, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, amongst other things.

loans.name: Medea

texts.en:
Medea is a 58-year-old unemployed woman, from the village of Akhalabastumani. She has a son, who lives abroad and his transfers are the only source of existence for Medea. 

She is very eager to start her own activity and generate income herself. For this reason, she requested a loan from local financial institutions several times and lastly was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that gives chances to people to start or re-start businesses. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Medea decided to start agricultural activity, which is profitable in her region and to purchase a cow. She will start producing milk-products and sell them locally for good prices. 

With support of the startup program, Medea will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle her financial difficulties. The loan will greatly assist her, and she will be able to improve her economic situation.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and start producing milk products

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a married man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a tailoring shop where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be the price fluctuations of tailoring materials. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy a new sewing machine and tailoring materials. 

His business goal is to own a larger tailoring shop within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory is a 24-year-old farmer from the Mt. Kenya region that experiences a cool and wet climate. She is newly married to her husband, Stanley, with whom they have a 3-year-old child. 

Glory started farming three years ago with next to nothing on a half acre piece of land. Today, she owns 3 cows and one sheep. She also started a business venture whose model is to collect cereal products from remote areas to sell in urban markets. 
 
She is seeking a KES 105,000 loan investment from the Kiva lenders to replenish the cereal stock of her business and buy farm inputs for her horticulture farm. 

She has planned to make loan repayments using income generated from sales of milk and cereals. This way, she stands to reap the full benefit of her hard work once the horticultural produce is ready for the market. 

At the end of the season, Glory plans to use part of the profit and roll back the rest into the business to drive growth and stability. Like any young parent, her long term plan is to be financially stable for her children

loans.use: to purchase inputs and supplies for her agri-business.

loans.name: Ishaya

texts.en: Ishaya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Joseph, Rudah, and Deborah. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ishaya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ishaya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ishaya  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually ensuring his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be promising. He operates a tailoring shop where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be the price fluctuations of tailoring materials. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy a new sewing machine. His business goal is to own a larger tailoring shop within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is a married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 9 years. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a retail business where he sells door hinges, screws,and farm tools. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in an area suitable for business and his primary customers are farmers. 

Bernard describes his biggest business challenge to be cost of transportation. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of farm tools. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of farm tools

loans.name: Cavin

texts.en:
Cavin is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be promising. He operates a tailoring shop where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be the price fluctuation of tailoring materials. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy a new sewing machine and tailoring materials. His business goal is to own a larger tailoring shop within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and tailoring materials.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is from Laguna, Philippines. She is married and has children. She has been employed in a garment factory in Cavite for two years now through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.*

Marian works as a Clothing Packer. She ensures that items of clothing are packed in the correct way and are ready for distribution. The type of packaging used depends on the type, value, fabric, and destination of the garments. One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Marian, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made many heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Marian is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying them since the loan payment is deducted every pay day.  She looks forward for your positive response and any coming amount from you will surely be of great help. She will also use the loan to get back the ATM card that she pawned and also to pay the educational expenses of her children.

Marian wants for her children to be able to complete their studies. She meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring, and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to get back the ATM card that she pawned and also to pay the educational expenses of her children

loans.name: Carlos Dionel

texts.es: Carlos es un señor de 61 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos mismos de los cuales el menor de 15 años asiste al colegio, Carlos empezó con su negocio desde hace 20 años atrás, y comenta que  empezó ofreciendo poca variedad de productos pero que al pasar del  tiempo y gracias a los créditos que ha obtenido en la actualidad da trabajo a 3 empleados y también a su hijo y su esposa le ayudan en este negocio, el crédito lo va  invertir en la compra de aceites, baterías y aditivos para  carros, Carlos espera seguir trabajando de buena manera y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Carlos is a 61-year-old man, he is married and has three children, of whom the youngest is 15 years old and goes to secondary school. Carlos began with his business 20 years ago, and says that he began offering a small variety of products but that with the passing of time, and thanks to the loans that he has gotten, currently he provides jobs to 3 employees and also his son and his wife who help him in this business. The loan will be invested in the purchase of oil, batteries, and additives for cars. Carlos hopes to continue working well and getting his family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase oil and batteries.

loans.name: Veriko

texts.en:
Veriko is a 40-years-old woman, from Telavi city in Georgia. She has school-aged daughter and works at the press service. Veriko has a fixed salary and tries to lead the family effectively. However she finds it hard and require any other additional income to cope. About 2 years ago she had a parallel activity, in particular, she was trading with clothing and had her own customers, but she stopped this business due to lack of financial funds. She has now requested a loan to local financial institutions to re-start this mentioned activity. Veriko's loan application was rejected several times and at last the start up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, approved it. 
Veriko plans to purchase stocks of home products and clothing at wholesale prices in the capital, where the widest market in the country is located. She will then sell the products in her community and among her loyal customers as well. This additional income will be a great support to her family, as Veriko will get an opportunity to provide good living conditions and better education for her daughter. They await your support and kindness.

loans.use: to re-start trading business and generate more income

loans.name: Yenis Nayibys

texts.es: Yenis, domiciliada en el municipio de Sabanalarga,  se encuentra dedicada al comercio de camisas, pantalones, zapatos, y Tablet,  su negocio inició en el año 2012, apoyada por su madre quien se dedica a esta misma actividad.  Yenis ha logrado desde entonces fidelizar a sus clientes por su excelente servicio y calidad de sus productos, a quienes les brinda facilidad de pago.  Ella se dedica 9 horas diarias a su negocio, el cual atiende todos los días; realiza sus compras de contado a almacenes ubicados en el centro de Barranquilla y realiza cobros a los clientes según las fechas pactadas.  Con la finalidad de ofrecer productos para esta temporada navideña, Yenis está aplicando a su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará mercancías varias según pedidos de sus clientes como ropa, calzado y detalles.  Yenis es madre de una hija de 11 años a quien desea ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida, por ello su meta familiar es hacer adecuaciones a su vivienda.  Su gran desafío es un sueño de prosperidad, ella busca incrementar su clientela para a futuro es tener un almacén.
texts.en:
Yenis lives in the municipality of Sabanalarga where she sells shirts, pants, shoes and tablets. She started her business in 2012 supported by her mother who is in the same business. Since then Yenis has managed to gain her clients loyalty with her excellent service and quality of her goods and the ease of payments she provides. She works 9 hours each day at her business, where she works every day. She makes her purchases in the warehouses in the center of Barranquilla and collects from her clients on established dates.

With the goal of offering products for this Christmas season, Yenis is requesting her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy a variety of merchandise depending on requests from clients like clothing, footwear and accessories.

Yenis is the mother of an 11 year old daughter to whom she wants to provide a better quality of living. So her family goal is to make improvements to her house. Her great challenge is the dream of prosperity. She looks to increase her clientele so in the future she can have a store.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise to fill the orders of clients for clothing, shoes and accessories.

loans.name: Juliene

texts.en:
Juliene is 44 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 4 and 21 years, whom all of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for 21 years now. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy maize fertilizers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumptions. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy maize fertilizers for sale.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is a factory worker. He is from Cavite, Philippines and he is married. He is one of the beneficiaries of the employment program of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.*

Romeo works as a Production Line Leader. He conducts inspections and tests per a control plan, work instructions, and procedures. He maintains good housekeeping at all times in his respective working area. He is also responsible for the group of operators and carries out manpower utilization effectively to meet shipments. One of the main dilemmas of employees like Romeo is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses, and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that has made many heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral.

For this reason, Romeo is asking for your assistance to prevent him from being exposed to loan sharks. He has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and he had no problem in repaying since the loan payment is deducted every pay day. He looks forward for your positive response and any assistance from you will surely be of great help. He will use the loan to meet his personal needs, help his extended family, and to pay for their funeral expenses.

Romeo hopes to give his children a good life in the future. He also wants to have a stable source of income to meet the everyday needs of his family. He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his work.

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, qualify for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conduct fellowship meetings for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions, spiritual mentoring, and discipleship sessions take place during pre- and post-working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to meet personal needs, help his extended family, and to pay for their funeral expenses

loans.name: Paola Gabriela

texts.es: Paola tiene 21 años de edad, ella vive con su madre y sus 2 hermanos que estan estudiando, Paola termino la educación básica y no pudo continuar sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos, Paola es una joven de carácter tranquilo y se dedica a  trabajar al jornal y a la crianza de animales menores ya que es así como obtiene sus ingresos para sus gastos y apoyar a su madre pagando del arriendo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos ya que comenta que es un buen negocio y de este aspira mejorarlo y seguir luchando por la vida.
texts.en: Paola is 21 years old. She lives with her mother and two siblings who are students. Paola finished her primary education and couldn't continue her education due to the lack of economic resources. Paola is a young woman with a calm personality and she works as a day laborer and raising small animals since that is how she gets income for her expenses and to help her mother pay the rent. The loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs since she says it is a good business and from this she hopes to improve it and continue struggling for a life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: Loise is a maize farmer from Kwankwani village in Kaduna state. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Loise would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, in order to cater for her immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Loise can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest time. Loise, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for her family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in her community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Mujittafa Maintai

texts.en: Mujittafa Mainta is a maize farmer from Bamiyayi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Mujittafa Mainta would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, in order to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mujittafa Mainta can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest time. Mujittafa Mainta, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Dayyabu

texts.en: Dayyabu is a maize farmer from Barangwaje village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dayyabu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, in order to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dayyabu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Dayyabu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and rebar, and to pay for labor

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a Kiva borrower. He has three children. He describes himself to be God-fearing. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. 

George describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough working capital. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Mara Ageni

texts.es:
Mara es una mujer de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.
Es madre de 3 hijos y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlos adelante.

Ella tiene una pequeña chaza en la que vende frituras, golosinas y refrescos, adicional a esto trabaja en producción y venta de comidas que ella misma prepara en su casa para llevar a su negocio.

Trabaja todos los días de 5:00 Am  a 3:00 Pm para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes. 

Ella desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar surtido de bebidas y frituras, además desea comprar insumos para su producción de alimentos.

Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
Mara is a woman with experience, wisdom, and a lot of patience.

She is the mother of 3 children and has worked practically her whole life to get them ahead.

She has a small food stall where she sells fried snacks, sweets, and soft drinks. In addition to this, she works making and selling dishes that she prepares herself in her house to bring to her business. 

She works every day from 5:00 am to 3:00 pm to have her products ready and fresh for her customers.

She wants to capitalize her business and have a great advance of supplies and product inventory, so she asks for a loan to purchase an assortment of drinks and fried goods, and also she wants to purchase supplies for her food production. 

One of her principal difficulties is the lack of money to invest in her business, but she trusts in the help of Corporación Interactuar and the good hearts of the Kiva lenders to get her business ahead.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her food production.

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
El es Orlando, un hombre de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su familia.
El decidió por iniciar con un negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos y bebidas en su propia cafetería desde hace aproximadamente 3 años en un pequeño local con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica, con la necesidad y el gusto por las ventas y la gastronomía, esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio con la ayuda de los prestadores de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar insumos para sus preparaciones como carnes y harinas.

Con este crédito podrá sostener su negocio y hacerlo crecer cada día más.

Es un hombre que asume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
Orlando is a man of character and good will, with the desire to progress and get ahead with his family.

He decided to start his business preparing and selling food and drinks in his own cafeteria approximately 3 years ago in a small retail space with a lot of desire and drive. 

He learned this work in an empirical way, with a need and a taste for sales and gastronomy, this allowed him to get a lot of experience.

These days, he wants to give a small boost to his business with the help of the Kiva lenders and the Corporación Interactuar. For this reason he wants a loan to purchase supplies for his dishes such as meats and flours.

With this loan, he will be able to sustain his business and make it grow more every day.

He is a man who takes on challenges and faces them with courage.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his dishes such as meats and flours.

loans.name: Gbêbré Group

texts.fr: Oho, membre représentatif du groupe est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle prépare du dolo, une boisson locale du Burkina Faso pour vendre. cette boisson est faite à partir du sorgho et de la levure. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter 7 sacs de mil rouge(sorgho) à 150000 francs et le reste de l'argent servira à payer du bois, du levure, de l'eau et autre pour faire son dolo. A l'issue de la vente, Oho pourrait faire des bénéfices qui lui permettront de prendre en charges les petites dépenses de ses enfants, de se soigner en cas de malade et de continuer son activité.
texts.en: Oho, who is the representative of the group, is married and mother to four children. She makes "dolo", a local Burkina Faso drink which she then sells; this drink is made from sorghum and yeast. She needs this loan to buy seven sacks of red millet (sorghum) at a cost of 150,000 francs, and the remainder of the money will be used to pay for wood, yeast, water and other products to make her dolo. By selling her drink, Oho would be able to make sufficient profit to cover her own expenses as well as those of her children, to take care of herself if she fell ill and to continue running her business.

loans.use: to buy sorghum (red millet) to make "dolo" (a local drink) and sell it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goats to raise and sell

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Liberal Arts and Sciences. Here is his story:

“One of the reasons why I want to study at AUCA is because of a high and qualified education. The fact that AUCA is not interacted with corruption interests me the most.

There is much diversity in AUCA as it is an American University of Central Asia; students from different countries come to study here. I like the AUCA atmosphere and AUCA spirit, where all teachers and students are tolerant and kind to help others, and they do it with pleasure.

Since childhood I dreamt to get education in International and Business Law. The reason why I want to be in IBL is because of global problems like poverty and war between nations and countries. The tears that come from little children make me feel upset and push me to choose this field, which helps me to support my country and those desperate families. As people say, if the person wants to change the world, he/she should start from himself/herself. 

I find the lawyer profession very responsible and respectful one. And think that a lawyer is a representative of the country and he/she isn’t to make any kind of mistakes as he/she is to save one’s life. I can say that I am a responsible person and this profession is for me. I have a great desire to study and I have a dream to realize. Thanks to Kiva lenders I can get a degree at AUCA, gain experience in my field and earn belief of the people in me.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of cassava to make into dough to resell and make more money.

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha vive con sus padres pero luego de culminar sus estudios primarios se propuso empezar a estudiar en la universidad para tener un titulo.
Esta estudiando la carrera de administracion de empresas, y por medio de su trabajo quiere poder ayudar su familia a ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus materiales de estudio y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Mirtha lives with her parents but after finishing her primary education, she pushed herself to study at the university to get a degree.

She is studying in a business administration program, and through her work she wants to be able to support her family and improve their living conditions.

She asks for this loan to purchase course materials and in this way be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to purchase course materials.

loans.name: Jen-Jen

texts.en:
Jen-Jen is married and they have children. She is from Cavite, Philippines, and she works in a garment factory that has partnership with CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Jen-Jen is a Human Resource Officer.  She is responsible for providing support in the various human resource functions, which include recruitment, staffing, training and development, performance, monitoring and employee counseling. She also provides advice and assistance to supervisors and staff. This may include information on training needs and opportunities, job descriptions, performance reviews and personnel policies of the Council.

One of the main dilemmas of employees, like Jen-Jen, is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses and they have no access to savings or credit, a situation that made them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who captured their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Jen-Jen is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to any loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in returning it back since the loan payment is being deducted every pay day.  She looks forward for your positive response and any help from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to purchase personal needs and to pay for the educational needs of her child who is in elementary.

Jen-Jen wants for her children to be always healthy and also daily provision for the needs of her family. She hopes to give her family a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects.  The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families.  Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: to purchase personal needs and to pay for the educational expense of her child who is in elementary school

loans.name: Luis Arnoldo

texts.es: Luis es un hombre de 29 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 18, 14 y 2 años de edad. Él buscando darle lo mejor a su familia decidió hace 3 años dedicarse a la albañilería actividad que le ha permitido sostener la economía de su familia y apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios. Luis desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado y construir una pila en su vivienda que le permita tener un lugar adecuado para guardar el agua que utiliza en su hogar, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, lámina y mano de obra para cambiar el techo y construir una pila en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis is a 29 year old man who lives in his own house together with his life companion and his 3 children aged 18, 14 and 2 years old. He looks to provide the best for his family. Three years ago he decided to work in bricklaying, an activity that has allowed him to maintain the family economy and support his children in their studies.

Luis wants to replace the roof on his house as it is now in poor condition and construct a washstand at his house which will allow him to have an adequate place to store the water that they use in the house. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, laminate and to pay for labor to replace the roof of his house and build a washstand.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, bricks, laminate and to pay for labor to replace his roof and construct a washstand for his house.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Her name is Juvy, 40, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is a mother of three children, of which two are in High School and one in Elementary Level in school. She manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's daily needs and for the schooling of her children.
 
Juvy operates a salon and spa business. She offers manicures and pedicures, massages, facial masks, diamond peel and other beauty services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 3000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan which she will use to buy beauty supplies and equipment for her salon and spa such as facial creams, oils, disinfectant, utensils and other equipment needed for her business. She expects a lot of customers as Christmas is fast approaching and people would want to look beautiful on family reunions and office parties.

Juvy dreams to have a bigger salon to accommodate more clients. She wants for her children to earn a College Degree and become professionals. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty supplies and equipment for her salon and spa service.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Her name is Petronila, 57, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Married to Policarpio, her business partner, and mother to their five children, of which three are in High School and two are in the Elementary Level in school. She manages their own household while operating their business. She is works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Petronila operates a buy-and-sell business. She buys RTW clothes from a wholesaler and sells them at retail price in a stall in a local market. Customers are attracted to buy due to her low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan which she will use to buy RTW merchandise items such as different styles of wearing apparel for women, men and children. She expects a higher demand for her items as Christmas is fast approaching. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her for it will surely help cover her family's basic needs and for her children's education. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Petronila hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She wants her children to earn a College Degree for them to become professionals. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for RTW clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jessika Carolina

texts.es: Jessika es una mujer de 32 años de edad, casada y madre de 2 hijos quienes viven y depende de ellos. Ella cuenta con un grado de educación primario completo que pudo cursar gracias al apoyo de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a cultivar maíz. Actualmente los ingresos económicos son generados a través de la siembra de maíz en compañía de su pareja la cual es su único apoyo trabajando en un terreno que es propio gracias a una herencia de sus suegros. También cuenta con un negocio de pulperia desde hace un tiempo con el cual le va bien pero no lo suficiente como para poder dar asistencia a sus cultivos de maíz y comprar los diferentes insumos agrícolas para la misma. Los clientes para su producto de maíz ya desgranado y limpio son las diferentes bodegas e intermediarios al igual que es vendido en su propia pulperia a los vecinos y demás clientes que llegan a la misma para adquirir los diferentes productos para cocina en sus hogares. Actualmente ella necesita ayuda para la compra de semilla certificada de maíz para poder cultivar ya que por medio de esta ella podrá cultivar más y sus ingresos serán mayores para mejorar el negocio. Sus planes son mejorar y abonar la tierra que ellos cultivan para que la semilla nueva se pueda cosechar y la planta crezca sana y fértil facilitando el mantenimiento de sus cultivos. Su sueño como toda madre apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y lograr hacer que ellos se superen y obtengan un mayor conocimiento estudiantil para poder integrarse fácilmente a la sociedad y encontrar mejores oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Jessika is a 32-year-old woman, married, and mother of 2 children who live with and depend on them. She has a full primary level of education that she could complete thanks to the support of her parents. It was them who taught her to grow corn. Currently, the economic income is generated through planting corn along with her partner who is her only support working the land, which is theirs thanks to an inheritance from her in-laws. She also has had a small general store business for some time, which is going well for her but it is not enough to be able to support her corn crops and purchase the different agricultural products for it. 

The customers for her shelled and clean corn product are the different warehouses and intermediaries, as well as selling it in her own shop to the neighbors and other customers who come there to get different products for cooking in their homes. Currently, she needs help to purchase certified corn seeds to be able to cultivate them now, since with this she will be able to grow more and her income will be greater to improve her business. Her plans are to improve and fertilize the land that they cultivate so that the new seeds will be able to be harvested and the plant will grow healthy and fertile, easing the maintenance of her corps. Her dream, like all mothers, is to support her children in their education and make it possible that they better themselves and have better academic knowledge to be able to integrate themselves easily in society and find better job opportunities.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, manure and pay labor costs to help with her corn crop.

loans.name: Bahtebigim

texts.ru: Бахтебигим признательна за помощь и поддержку. Она на заемные деньги отремонтировала дом. Для Бахтебигим этот кредит стал большой помощью, для нее и для ее семьи. После кредитования она всерьез взялась за сельскохозяйственную деятельность. Она начала работать на земле. Бахтебигим хочет зарабатывать своим честно нажитым трудом. Она благодарит за первый кредит и чувствует, что ей удастся получить финансирование во второй раз. На этот раз Бахтебигим просит поддержки для посева нового урожая. На денежные средства она купит минеральные удобрения и семена. Она заранее благодарит Вас!
texts.en:
Bahtebigim is grateful for the help and support. With the money borrowed she renovated her home. For Bahtebigim this loan was a great help to her and her family. 

After the loan she has been engrossed in crop cultivation. She started working the land. Bahtebigim wants to process her fairly acquired land. She thanks for the first loan and she feels that she is able to get financing for the second time. 

This time Bahtebigim requests support for sowing new crops. For the money she will purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds. She thanks in advance!

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds to sow winter crops

loans.name: Sumac Puririsun Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dominga ella es viuda y tiene 73 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que por medio de este negocio quiere que sus hijos terminen de estudiar, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Sumac Puririsun" communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, part of Cusco province and Cusco department. 

The member is Dominga. She is a widow and is 73 years old and has 5 children. She works in her business raising and selling animals. She raises guinea pigs and chickens. She raises them and fattens them and later sells them in the different fairs. She is an enterprising woman who, through this business, wants her children to finish their education. Her dream is to expand her business of guinea pig and chickens sales. She asks for a loan to purchase guinea pigs and chickens and feed for the guinea pigs and chickens.

The other members work in beauty product sales, craft sales, a grocery store, and animal sales. 

She is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this platform and promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and chickens and feed for the guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Carlos Adalberto

texts.es: Carlos de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa ysu hijo, el se dedica desde hace 15 años al cultivo de elotes,comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados ya tiene clientes establecidos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus cultivos y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Carlos is 34 years old and lives in hie own house with his wife and his child. For 15 years he has been growing sweet corn. He sells his product in different markets and has regular clients. With what he makes from his sales he manages to get ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicide, etc. to continue with his growing and have higher income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Homiya

texts.ru: Хомия 33 летняя жительница района Яван. Она мать четверых детей. У ее два сына и две дочки. Дети учатся в средней школе. Хомия трудолюбивая женщина. Она любит животных и поэтому Хомия занимается животноводством в сельской местности. Выращиванием скотов она занята уже больше двух лет. Хомия покупает молодых телят и откармливает их и перепродает на скотном рынке. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы увеличить поголовья скотов. Хомия за счет денежных средств купить молодых бычков и телят. Этот кредит станет для нее важной поддержкой для достижения новых целей в сфере животноводческой деятельности.
texts.en:
Homiya is a 33 years old resident of the Yavan region. She is the mother of four children. She has two sons and two daughters. The children go to high school. 

Homiya is a hard working woman. She loves animals and therefore works with livestock breeding in a rural area. She has worked with livestock breeding for more than two years already. She purchases young calves and fattens them and resells them at the livestock market. 

Homiya applied for a loan in order to increase the number of livestock. With the money, she will purchase young bulls and calves. This loan is important for her in order to reach her new goals in the livestock breeding area.

loans.use: to increase the number of livestock

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Juan de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y pipían desde hace 20 años, vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados y ya tiene clientes fijos por los buenos precios, Juan esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, bombas de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas así como muestra la fotografía para poder continuar con sus siembras y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Juan is 42 years old. He lives in his own house with his family. He has grown corn and squash for 20 years. He sells his product in different markets and has regular clients due to his good prices. Juan is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer pumps, manure, pest control, and herbicides as shown in the photo to be able to continue with his growing and have higher income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer pumps, manure, pest control and herbicides as shown in the photo.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos, el se dedica a realizar viajes de carga en su camión y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelante, el quiere mejorar vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero no tiene de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cementos, ladrillos, arena, hierro, laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra para que el y sus hijos puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Luis is 37 years old and lives in his own house with his 5 children. He works transporting cargo in his truck and has lots of clients. He manages to get ahead with what he earns from his work. He want to improve his house building a room in the place in the photo but he does not have sufficient capital. So he is requesting a loan to buy cement, bricks, sand, re-bar beams and to pay for labor so that he and his children can live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, re-bar, beams and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Nasasagare Group

texts.fr:
Léonidas  fait partie du groupe  Nasagarare et  habite à  Cibitoke. Il a 60 ans et est marié à Vivine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de 16 à 41 ans, dont  2 étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce de  bière de banane  depuis  12 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bière de banane à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait   voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Léonidas belongs to the Nasagarare group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 60 years old and married to Vivine, who is a farmer. They have eight children together, ranging from 16 to 41 years of age, two of whom are students. 

Léonidas has been selling banana beer for the past 12 years and is on his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is granted, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of banana beer to resell so he can earn more money.

In the coming years he would like to see his children through school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of banana beer to resell so he can make more money.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 22 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte del Perú. Los habitantes de esta zona se dedican al comercio y crianza de ganado menor como actividades económicas principales.

La actividad a la que se dedica Wilmer es a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en mototaxi (vehículo), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 4 años. Contando con experiencia en el negocio, es conocido en la zona por lo cual tiene clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El destino del crédito será para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento a su vehículo (mototaxi) lo que le permitirá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, incrementando su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer, 22, is single and lives in the Buenos Aires district of the province of Morropón in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.  The residents of the area work in the main economic activities: commerce and raising small animals.

Wilmer provides motorcycle taxi transportation services to passengers, a job he has done for more than four years.  

The loan is to perform necessary maintenance on his vehicle.  This will allow him to provide better customer service, increase his income, and improve his family's quality of life as a result.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on his vehicle (motorcycle taxi)

loans.name: Jabez

texts.en: Jabez is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be God fearing. He operates a tailoring shop where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough working capital. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Dukoranedukore Group

texts.fr:
Déo  fait partie du groupe  Dukoranedukore et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 37 ans et est marié Christine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 10 ans, dont  2 étudient.
 
Il fait le commerce des habits   depuis  12 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d'habits à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle, et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Déo belongs to the Dukoranedukore group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 37 years old and married to Christine, who is a farmer. They have four children together, ranging from one to ten years of age, two of whom are at school. 

Déo has been selling clothing for the past 12 years and is on his second loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is granted, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of clothes to resell so he can earn more money.

In the coming years he would like to buy a plot of land and see his children through school.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of clothes to resell so he can make more money.

loans.name: Eddy Martin

texts.es: Las ganas de salir adelante son las que caracterizan a Eddy de 39 años de edad. Tiene un pequeño Cyber hace cinco años, Eddy ya ha sido beneficiado con los financiamientos que ofrece MiCrédito-KIVA el cual le han apoyado en gran manera. Este negocio le ha sido de mucha ayuda para mantenerse el y su esposa, pero los ingresos que tiene no son suficientes para suplir todas las necesidades en su hogar, es por eso que Eddy solicita un crédito para mejorar la infraestructura de su baño y brindarle a su familia las mejores condiciones higiénicas. De esta manera el crédito le beneficiará en gran manera y así evitara cualquier enfermedad.
texts.en: Eddy, 39, is known for his strong desire to get ahead.  He's had a small internet cafe for 5 years.  Eddy has benefited from the loans offered by MiCredito-Kiva; they have been a major source of support for his business.  The business has been a great help in supporting Eddy and his wife, but the income that he has is not enough to cover all of the needs of the household.  This is why Eddy is requesting a loan to improve his bathroom to give his family better hygienic facilities.  In this way, the loan will benefit him greatly, and will also help his family to avoid illness.

loans.use: to improve his bathroom

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
Ulugbek is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Economics. Here is his story:

"My name is Ulugbek. I am good in Math and calculations that applied to the Economics Program. I was a very active school-boy. In the 11th grade I was very enthusiastic to take part in the Teenagers-In-Free-Enterprise (TIFE) competition. I was a member of my school’s team and we were the winners of that championship. Moreover I am most enthusiastic about another project-opening of the cricket stadium in Bishkek as well as squash courts. I got a lot of experience in managing finance of this project as I was responsible for the financial part of our business project.

I know that AUCA is a place where you can obtain a higher knowledge, for which you have to pay a lot of money. The fact is that my admission concurs with the hard time of my family. My family consists of five people: my mother, two brothers, my sister and me. My sister is married, has a baby and lives separate from us. Unfortunately, in 2006 we lost my father, and my elder brother had serious problems with his health, that he had to undergo several surgeries, which caused my mother’s unemployment. She is a house-wife and looks after my brother. My second brother is a beginner entrepreneur.  He is to support all of us and it’s getting really hard for him to do this year by year.

Taking into consideration my family’s condition, I don’t want to be a burden to them, and requesting Kiva loan to pay for my tuition. I want be free, well-educated, confident of my future and master of my life. I kindly ask Kiva lenders to give me a chance to prove that I’m worthy of financial support.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cement and wood to renovate his house from the inside.

loans.name: Kanatbek

texts.en:
Kanatbek is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Comparative Politics. Here is his story:

“I am requesting a Kiva loan because my family can’t afford my university tuition fee. I am thankful for AUCA in making me a discount, but still the rest of the tuition is too high for me. I have a great desire to study at AUCA, because AUCA is among the few higher education establishments in the region, which offer a social science education.

I am proud to be a winner of the one-year-study-program at New Generation Academy in 2013. This Program not only covered fully my tuition for that year, allowed me to get a stipend and housing, but changed the whole world for me. First, it taught me English and made familiar with AUCA. Second, it presented me a lot of friends from different parts of Kyrgyzstan, who were eager to gain knowledge. Third, thanks to it I could pass the entering exams of AUCA. 

When I was eleven we lost my father. My mother raised me alone and always worked to keep us, to give me a good education. As my mother is a school teacher, she has a small salary, which is not even enough for our daily necessities. Sometimes we get support from our relatives, but they have their own families and aren’t able to help us always. 

I know that Kiva changes people's life for the better. I hope it will do the same with mine.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Her name is Aileen, 33, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Married to Christopher, who is a van driver and has two children who are both in high school. She manages her household while operating the business. She and her husband help each other to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs as well as to send her children to school. 

Aileen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also has a van which her husband drives for transport service for added income. She also sells branded products like dresses, bags, and shoes. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 2000 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 50000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. Part of the loan she will use to pay for local branded dress, shoes and bags to sell. She expects a higher demand for grocery items, dress, shoes and bags as Christmas is fast approaching. She is thanking God and you in advance fora good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given her for it will surely help cover their daily needs and for her children's education. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Aileen hopes to maintain and grow her business so she they could have a better life. She strives to hard to give her children the best education possible and prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items such as rice, dry goods and dress, bags for sale as well.

loans.name: Jerebie

texts.en:
Jerebie is thankful that she was granted a 11,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay the continuous maintenance of her tricycle unit. It is very important that her tricycle is always in a good running condition to ensure continuous efficient service to her customers. She will also use part of the loan to add some groceries to her small general store, which she is her second business. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment - the financial help that will be given her for it will greatly help in sending her children to College. 

Jerebie hopes to buy another unit in the future and expand her general store someday. She aims to give her children the best education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and pay for maintenance of her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works the land and does farming. She earns a living by growing and selling rice. She is married woman from Mcarthur, Leyte with five grown-up children. Aside from rice farming, Editha also engages in selling frozen goods like ham, sausages, and hotdogs. She has been engaged in this kind of business for a year now. The photo shows Editha standing in front of several sacks of rice harvested just this season.

Editha is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and additional stock of frozen goods. These materials are very helpful in her day-to-day living because she can now offer a variety of frozen goods and also improve her farming business. This will create higher yields and start to augment her income.

Editha will try her best to handle both her businesses to be more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice farming and additional stock of frozen foods for resale

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Her name is Mirasol, 42, a resident of GMA, Cavite in the Philippines. She is married to Domingo, a driver, and they have two children, who are already working. She and her husband work hard to support their needs and save for their old age. 

Mirasol buys fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located at their town market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php2000 in sales every day.

To help continue and expand her business, she is requesting for a Php 25000 loan which she will use to buy more barrels of fish. Her steady earnings in her fish stall is a great help in meeting their everyday needs and in supporting her aging parents.

Mirasol dreams to have a bigger space for her fish stall to improve her earnings. She wants to continue to take care of her aging parents and save as well for her old age. She also wants her children to lead a happy and quiet life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities and kinds of fish to sell at her stall.

loans.name: Ma. Tessie

texts.en:
Ma. Tessie previously accessed an 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy vitamins and medicine products to sell. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of medicine and vitamins that she will sell to her customers. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ma. Tessie hopes that her family is always healthy and free from any illness. She also wants to expand her store and manage her own clinic someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of medicine and vitamins needed in her pharmacy.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana se desempeña exitosamente en su negocio de reparación y venta de electrodomésticos, siendo una persona muy reconocida en el barrio por su buen trabajo y servicio. 

Ya que ha laborado 7 años con los conocimientos que adquirió por medio de su trabajo en distintos talleres, ha tenido la oportunidad de mantener su trabajo y ha intentado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 

Por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de neveras, lavadoras y estufas en mal estado para repararlas y venderlas a un mejor precio.

Con estos elementos podrá continuar prestando su servicio ya que este es su único medio de trabajo y supervivencia.

Actualmente es casada y tiene un hijo de 5 años a los cuales siempre trata de ayudar económicamente para que puedan sustentar su hogar y mejorar su vida. 

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran taller con varios empleados y poco a poco podrá lograr su objetivo. 

Ayuda a una madre emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Ana works successfully in her business repairing and selling household appliances, and is a person very well-known in her neighborhood for her good work and service.

She has worked for 7 years with the knowledge that she acquired through working in different shops. She has had the opportunity to maintain her work and has tried to improve her family's living conditions.

For this reason she wants to ask for a loan to purchase refrigerators, washing machines, and stoves in bad condition to repair them and sell them at a better price.

With these appliances, she will be able to continue offering her services since it is her only means of work and survival.

Currently, she is married and has a 5-year-old son to whom she always tries to help economically to be able to sustain their household and improve their life.

Her greatest dream is to be able to have a large shop with several employees and little by little she will be able to achieve this goal. 

Help this enterprising mother with the desire to get ahead with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase refrigerators, washing machines and stoves in bad condition to repair them.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna lives with her family in the village Darpas of Lori region. She has higher pedagogical education and for the past 30 years, she is a devoted pedagogue. She works at the school as a teacher of mathematics. She is a patient and kind teacher and she likes her work with children, who after graduating their school do not forget to visit their beloved and respected teacher. Ruzanna also gives paid private courses of mathematics at her house, by this way preparing pupils for the entrance examinations. Ruzanna lives with her husband and two sons. She would be happy to receive this loan as she wants to buy a computer through which she will gain awareness of any methodological innovations in teaching processes and programs.

loans.use: to buy a computer, through which she will gain awareness of any methodological innovations in teaching processes and programs

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 45 years old and she lives in Yerevan city. She has a specialty as a dispenser, but she has never worked in her specialty. She has worked at different companies as a worker; now she works at a dry cleaning service as a manager. She lives with her daughter-in-law and her grandchild. Lila’s son is now in the Russian Federation, where he works and transfers money to his family from there. Lilia now greatly needs to pass a course of teeth treatment, but her family’s financial hardships do not allow her to have such a great expenditure, since as Lilia says her son works very hard to cover their needs and she does not want to create any new problems for him. Lilia is requesting for this loan since she wants to solve her dental problem and to pass a course of teeth treatment.

loans.use: to solve her dental problem and to pass a course of teeth treatment

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es:
Nubia ha sido una ama de casa muy dedicada, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por sus hijos y su esposo; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 5 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar junto con su esposo y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son vecinos, familiares y amigos del sector, trabaja sola todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de ropa, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada de navidad, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Nubia manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a todos sus hijos, para verlos convertirse en profesionales y tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Nubia has been a very dedicated housewife, always available to care for her family, made up of her children and her husband, she has always liked to work as an independent salesperson. She began to sell merchandise 5 years ago, since she is responsible to bring economic support to the household with her husband and she needs to generate the resources to do it. 

Her customers are her neighbors, family members, and friends in the sector. She works alone every day in her business and finds in her work the advantage of being able to be close to her family, at the same time managing to be productive as a salesperson.

Currently, she is asking for a loan to purchase an assortment of clothing in bulk, since it is a great opportunity in this season. This will allow herself to supply herself with more variety to be able to satisfy the demand that increases in the Christmas season and, as a result, get more income for her family.

Numia says that her greatest desire is to be able to continue supporting her family economically and provide an education to all her children, to see them become professionals and have a prosperous and successful future.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Jerever

texts.en:
Jerever is a male client, aged 59 years old. He has a family of seven children, all of whom attend school. He was advanced a loan amounting to UGX 5,000,000 to improve his business of beans and maize farming. Jerever is also a poultry  farmer and also undertakes brewing of local alcohol, which he started in 1999 at Byesika Sembabule with the aim of looking after his family. He also plans to use this loan to buy corn for resale and also to restock poultry. His major challenge is the variation in climatic conditions, especially the heavy sunshine that affects production.

Pictured is Jerever and the Ugafode credit officer (left to right).

loans.use: To buy corn for resale and to restock his poultry

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en:
Ambrose is a 32-year-old single man with two children. He operates a small garage at Kisiizi trading center as his main source of income. He has done this job for six years. Ambrose has been taking loans from Ugafode for his business since his capital alone couldn’t meet the needs of his clients. Financial assistance from Ugafode has enabled him to sustain and expand his business. 

Ambrose applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy building materials to finish his first house. He wants to buy doors, windows, cement, and paint for completion of his house.  He is thankful that Ugafode has come to his rescue at his most dire time of need.

loans.use: To buy building materials to finish his first house

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 37 years old and married and has four children, who are all in school. She lives in Nsangi with her family. She raises chicken as her source of income. This has has helped her to be able to take care of the needs of her family.

Inadequate capital is the challenge she faces. She plans to add more chicks and also to buy feeds for them so that they can grow very fast and be fat, which will increase her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy young chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Ruby Stella

texts.es:
Ruby, de 63 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella se desempeña como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como bisutería, accesorios de vestir y perfumes.

Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento ya que es viuda.
Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de mercancía y de este modo tener inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes en esta temporada de navidad que es tan especial.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
Ruby, 63, knows exactly what she wants for her life and she's determined to make progress and have a good life.

She's a vendor of a variety of merchandise such as costume jewelry, accessories, and perfume.  She started this job with a desire for the resources she needed to support herself, because she's a widow.  She's an enterprising and very disciplined woman.

Ruby requested the loan to buy a wide supply of merchandise to have inventory available to sell to her customers this Christmas season, which is so special.
