She hopes to be able to get ahead as an entrepreneur and have more stable income.

loans.use: to buy a big supply of clothing and perfume merchandise

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es: María tiene 42 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos de 7, 5 y 4 años de edad. Ella recorre cada día las calles del municipio para ofrecer su mercadería que consiste en mariscos y pescados, donde ya la esperan sus clientes, con lo que logra llevar el sustento a su familia. María desea comprar una puerta de hierro para instalarla en su vivienda, además desea afinar el piso de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, una puerta y mano de obra para afinar el piso e instalar una puerta en su vivienda.
texts.en: María is 42 years old, and lives in her own house along with her life partner and their three children, ages 7, 5, and 4. She makes the rounds of the streets in the municipality every day to offer her merchandise which consists of shellfish and fish, where her customers are waiting for her. With what she manages to get, she provides sustenance to her family. María wants to purchase an iron door to install in her house, and also she wants to finish the floor in the house. For this, she has asked FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, a door, and pay labor costs to finish the floor and install a door in her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, a door, and labor costs to finish the floor and install a door in her house.

loans.name: Orfa Nelly

texts.es:
Orfa es una bella mujer de 51 años de edad, madre de 2 hijos, criada con unas muy buenas costumbres, desde el colegio desarrollo una gran pasión y gusto por todo lo relacionado con la belleza.  

Inicio su etapa productiva realizando cursos y capacitaciones, hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio de salón de belleza en su hogar. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido pues también quiere vender productos para complementar sus servicios, como crema de manos, gel, productos capilares, tinturas para cabello, barnices, también realizará algunas mejoras locativas.

El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Su sueño es que su empresa progrese de la mano de Interactuar y tenga muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Orfa is a beautiful woman, 51 years old, mother of 2 children, raised with some very good customs, and since school has developed a great passion and taste for everything related to beauty. 

She began her productive stage taking courses and training until one day she took a risk and decided to go looking for her own clientele, opening a beauty salon business in her home. 

She asks for a loan to purchase an assortment of things because she wants to sell products to complement her services, such as hand cream, gel, hair products, hair dye, nail polish, and also to make some improvements to the space. 

For her, the loan will be very important because she will finish establishing her business, completing it with all the necessary supplies to operate and offer whatever service someone may request. 

Her dream is that her business progresses with a hand from Interactuar and that she has many clients.

loans.use: to purchase hand cream, gel, hair products, hair dye, nail polish, and also to do some improvements to the retail space.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es: María de 50 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 4 nietos de 16, 13, 10 y 5 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de mariscos y pescado actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años y que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. María es una mujer visionaria que siempre está buscando la manera de darle lo mejor a sus familia por lo que en la medida de sus posibilidades ha construido su vivienda, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica para comprar las ventanas y pagar por su instalación, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ventanas y pago de mano de obra para instalar las ventanas de su vivienda.
texts.en: María, 50 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner and their 4 grandchildren, ages 16, 13, 10 and 5. She is an enterprising woman who earns her living selling shellfish and fish, work that she has done for 8 years and that has allowed her to get her family ahead. María is a visionary woman who is always looking for the way to give her family the best, and in midst of these possibilities, she has constructed her house, but she doesn't have the economic liquidity to purchase the windows and pay for their installation, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in windows and pay labor costs to install the windows in her house.

loans.use: to invest in windows and pay labor costs to install the windows in her house.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married mother of four children. She describes herself as God-fearing. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seed for planting. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seed to plant

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico en el caserío de Laynas ubicado en el distrito La Matanza, región Piura, en la costa norte del Perú. Este es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz.

El se dedica a la venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, actividad que realiza hace más de 06 años, contando con clientela fija quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y comerciales de el. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en alimento balanceado para el engorde de sus aves y sus ovejas así como para realizar mantenimiento del lugar donde los cría. Con esto Martin espera mejorar la productividad de su negocio, lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Martin is 58 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives in his own house made out of rustic materials in the village of Laynas located in La Matanza district, Piura region, on the North Coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this place work in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce. He has basic services like electricity and running water.

He works selling small animals like chickens, ducks, turkeys amongst others. He has been doing this for 6 years. He has regular clients who offer good personal and business references for him. The loan will be invested in balanced feed to fatten his poultry and sheep as well as doing maintenance on the place where he raises them. Doing this Martin hopes to increase the productivity of his business, which would allow him to increase his level of income and in the end raise his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to invest in balanced feed for his poultry and sheep and to do maintenance on the place where he raises them.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is a 32-year-old female client with a family of 4 children who are all in school. Given a loan of 1,800,000 UGX, She will buy poultry feed for her poultry birds. Her business is located at Kagango in Sembabule, and it has been in existence since 2001. She also uses part of this money to pay school fees for her children. Her major challenge is the increased price of the feed. She is hard working and hopes to get more loans to develop her family. She is thankful for the support.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be promising. He operates a retail shop where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for five years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. 

He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. His business goal is to have a large cereals store within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina aged 47 years and is married with 4 children, whom are all in school. She lives at biira kireka - a city in the outskirts, with her family. She operates a restaurant as her major source of income to meet her house hold needs and to pay tuition for her children. She has a problem of limited capital; this is the reason she is partnering with UGAFODE Microfinance to overcome this. She will use the loan to buy stocks of food stuffs for cooking so that she can meet the demand of her customers as well as also increase her working capital and sales. She plans to construct her own house and do away with rent problem.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn and matooke

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Isiyaku Goma

texts.en: Isiyaku Goma is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Dauda, Istifanus, and Shezekiya.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku Goma would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Isiyaku Goma spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children and eventually to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest time

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, shoes, and basins. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of basins and clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a boutique. This is her second  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of basins and clothes

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 27 years old and is married with 2 children, who are both in school. He also has dependents who are his siblings.

He lives at Nsangi with his family. He drives a motorcycle taxi as his source of income. He is challenged by having limited capital, especially to meet the needs of his family and pay his sister's tuition.

He will use this particular loan to complete the tuition payment for his sister who is sitting her end-of-semester examinations. He will repay the loan using money from motorcycle riding. Although he has a problem of less capital than he needs, he plans to buy another one.

He is patient and resilient and is confident that he will soon kick poverty out of his family.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his sister

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a married mother of four children. She describes herself as dedicated. She operates a farm where she grows crops. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of seed. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy seed for planting. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be better off financially. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seed for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase water tanks and fridges to sell, hoping to expand his business .

loans.name: Iskender

texts.en:
Iskender is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Business Administration. Here is his story:

“The economy is an integral part of any state. And all the efforts of the country on the way to the good life, one way or another, are directed to the economic growth. Nowadays, everything depends on the money, because we have to pay for every thing and for every service. Even the welfare of citizens, education, and medical care require significant financing. Therefore we can conclude that if we want to have a good life, we must take care of the financial situation and the economic stability of our country as a whole. I choose this profession to help myself and others.

"I am applying for the Kiva loan because my parents have a difficult time now. They are sellers at the market. I have a brother, who is a student at another university. It’s difficult for my parents to support two students at the same time, as we both are to pay university fees, buy books and use transportation daily.
 
"I am sure that AUCA will give me an infinite wealth of knowledge. A degree of Business Administration from AUCA will enable me to work for the good of my country. I will do all the best to bring stability and prosperity to my country. And this Kiva loan is the unique chance for me to make my first step and start the future path.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en: Isiyaku is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Labon, Biliya, and Suzanatu. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Isiyaku spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children to ensure they are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest time

loans.name: Criccia Maribel

texts.es: Criccia de 44 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 11 años de edad. Ella se dedica a lavar pipianes en una hacienda cercana para poder sostener la economía de su hogar y apoyar a sus hijos para que continúen sus estudios ya que desea que puedan aspirar a mejores condiciones de vida. Criccia desea cambiar la puerta de su vivienda ya que esta se encuentra deteriorada y encementar el piso del corredor ya que al ser de tierra permite que el agua se retenga lo que ha causado el deterioro de la puerta de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y una puerta para cambiar la puerta y encementar el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Criccia, 44 years old, lives in her own house with her 11-year-old son. She works cleaning pipian squashes at a nearby farm to be able to sustain the household economy and support her children so that they continue their schooling since she wants them to be able to aspire to better life conditions. 

Criccia wants to replace the door on her house since it is deteriorated, and cement the floor of the outdoor walkway since being dirt it retains the water and this has caused the deterioration of the door on the house, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and a door to replace the door and cement the outdoor walkway of her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel and a door to replace the door and cement the outdoor walkway of her house.

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es: Ana de 32 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su grupo familiar. Ella es reconocida por sus vecinos como una persona trabajadora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar desde hace 10 años, con lo que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ana ha logrado a base de esfuerzo construir un cuarto, pero no logró instalar puerta, ni ventana, además desea terminar el piso del mismo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una puerta, una ventana, cemento, arena y grava para terminar de encementar el piso y colocar la puerta y la ventana de su cuarto.
texts.en: Ana, 32 years old, lives in her own house with her family. She is known by the neighbors as a hard-working person who has earned her living offering domestic services in her clients' houses for the past 10 years. With that, she has managed to get her family ahead. Ana has managed, with her efforts, to build a room, but she didn't manage to install a door or a window, and in addition, she wants to finish the floor in it, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in a door, a window, cement, sand, and gravel to finish cementing the floor and to install a door and a window in her room.

loans.use: to invest in a door, a window, cement, sand and gravel, to finish cementing the floor and to install a door and window in her room.

loans.name: Habila

texts.en: Habila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Anoch and Edmund.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Habila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for  food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Habila  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually ensuring they are well-educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Yahaya Wada

texts.en: Yahaya Wada is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahaya Wada can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Yahaya Wada is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest time

loans.name: Yakubu Maiunguwa

texts.en: Yakubu Maiunguwa is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yakubu Maiunguwa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Yakubu Maiunguwa is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest time

loans.name: Lawan

texts.en: Lawan is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Istifanus, Yusha, and Ninaba. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Lawan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Lawan spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually ensuring his children are well-educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest time

loans.name: Ibrahim Dan-Danso

texts.en: Ibrahim Dan-Danso is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim Dan-Danso can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Ibrahim Dan-Danso is looking to earn a better living to provide more food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest time

loans.name: Eliane

texts.es:
Eliane está cursando segundo año de la carrera de ingeniería en marketing y publicidad. Sus metas futuras son trabajar en la profesión que esta estudiando, obtener mejores   ingresos  y ayudar a su mamá y a sus hermanas, ya que la misma es huérfana de padre. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, de manera a poder estar mas cerca de cumplir con su meta.
texts.en:
Eliane is in her second year in an engineering program in marketing and publicity. Her future goals are to work in the profession she is studying, earn more income, and help her mother and her sisters, since her father has died.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay her fees, to be able to be closer to achieving her goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Maribelle

texts.en:
Maribelle is a resident in the town of MacArthur, Leyte. She is a 26-year-old married woman with two young children. She is a chainsaw operator. She provides services like light trimming and heavy cutting of trees. Aside from that, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like sugar, cooking oil, powdered milk, eggs, noodles and coffee.  In the photo, Maribelle is standing beside several gallons of gasoline used to power the chainsaw.

Maribelle is asking for a loan to buy stock for the store and purchase an additional chainsaw. These will help Maribelle and her family to start operating her store, and they will also help to maintain the stock and attract more customers. She could also start to attract more customers with the aid of an additional chainsaw, thereby augmenting her income and providing her family with good food.

She is hoping that someday she can be successful in managing both of her businesses. Hopefully, this could be the beginning of achieving a sustainable livelihood in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy stock for the store and purchase an additional chainsaw

loans.name: Hokima

texts.ru: Эту добрую и жизнерадостную женщину зовут Хокима. Ей 49 лет. Она мать шестерых детей. Хокима замужем за учителя средней школы. Хомима 10 лет своей жизни посвятила деятельности шитья женских костюмов. Она любит свою работу и хочет дальше работать в этой сфере деятельности. Уже много лет она работала на одной швейной машинке и все свои работы она выполняла благодаря той машинке. Хокиме было тяжело расстаться с той швейной машинкой, но она была уже вне рабочем состоянии и Хокима приняла решение приобрести новую. Она хочет купить эту машинку, которую Вы видите на фотографии. Она стоит дорого и Хокиме не хватает немного денежных средств для реализации покупки. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы собрать недостающую сумму денег и купить ту швейную машинку.
texts.en:
This good and happy woman is called Hokima. She is 49 years old and the mother of six children. Hokima is married to a high school teacher. 

Hokima has dedicated 10 years of her life to the business of sewing women's clothing. She loves her work and would like to continue to work in this area. She has worked many years with one sewing machine and all her work has been performed thanks to this machine. It was hard for Hokima to part with this sewing machine, but it was already not working well and Hokima decided to purchase a new one. 

Hokima would like to purchase the sewing machine you can see on the photo. It is expensive and Hokima does not have enough money to make this purchase. She applied for a loan in order to gather the required amount of money to purchase this sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, as in the photo

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es: Remberto de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la crianza de ganado (lechero y repasto) desde hace 20 años, con lo que obtiene de las ventas de los productos logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de 5 toretes para seguir con su crianza y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Remberto is 42 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has made a living raising livestock (dairy and beef) for 20 years. The income he obtains from the sale of the products does solve some household expenses.

He is asking for a loan to purchase five steers and to continue raising them, therby obtaining higher incomes.

loans.use: to puchase five steers.

loans.name: Paula Del Carmen

texts.es: Paula de 38 años de edad es madre soltera y vive junto a sus 4 hijos de 21, 17, 14 y 13 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 8 años. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos en un centro educativo, además vende productos de belleza por catalogó obteniendo mejores ingresos. Paula desea terminar de construir el corredor de su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para terminar de construir el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en: Paula, 38 years old, is a single mother and has lived with her 4 children, ages 21, 17, 14 and 13, in her own home for the past 8 years.  She is an enterprising woman who earns her living providing domestic services in a school. In addition she sells beauty products by catalog, getting more income. Paula wants to finish constructing the outdoor walkway of her house, and for that she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, galvanized metal sheeting, beams, and pins to finish constructing the outdoor walkway of her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, galvanized metal sheeting, beams, and pins to finish constructing the outdoor walkway of her house.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 65 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza de cerdos, comercializa los cerdos en los diferentes mercados, con las ventas que realiza logra salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, Juan vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar de 5 cerdos y concentrado para poder continuar con la crianza de los mismo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan is 65 years old and has been raising pigs for the past number of years. He sells them in different markets and with the money he makes he is able to take care of the household expenses. He lives in his own house with his life partner.

He is asking for a loan so he can buy five pigs and feed so that he can continue to raise pigs and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy five pigs and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a batch of toys to sell.

loans.name: Hayriniso

texts.ru: На фотографии запечатлена молодая жительница района Файзабад по имени Хайринисо. Ей 28 лет. Она не замужем. Хайринисо в отличием закончила среднюю школу, к сожалению по обстоятельствам не смогла получить высшее образование. Но Хайринисо уже 3 года работает секретаршей. Она совмещает работу с другим видом деятельности как земледелие. Хайринисо прекрасно справляется с работой на земле. Причина обращения за кредитом со стороны Хайринисо является ремонт дома. Уже пришла время холодов, но она не успела сделать ремонт и подготовить дом к зиме. Хвала небесам, в Таджикистане еще сохраняется температура +8 С тепла. Из-за того что ей не хватает денег Хайринисо обратилась за кредитом. Она на денежные средства она сможет купить строй материалы, и за короткое время отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
In the photo you can see a young resident of the Fayzabad region, called Hayriniso. She is 28 years old. She is not married. 

Hayriniso finished high school with good grades, but due to circumstances she was unfortunately not able to get higher education. However, she has worked as a secretary for three years already. She combines this work with other activities such as agriculture. Hayriniso copes well with the agriculture work. 

The reason for Hayriniso's loan request is to renovate her home. The cold period has already set in, but she has not been able to renovate her house and prepare it for the winter. Thankfully the temperature in Tajikistan is still +8 degrees Celsius. Since Hayriniso does not have enough money, she applied for a loan. She will use the money to purchase material and in a short time renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and renovate her home

loans.name: Anjela

texts.en: Anjela is a married mother of six children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be small yields. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seed to plant. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy seeds to plant

loans.name: Frediana

texts.en:
Frediana is a 38-year-old lady who is married with 3 children who attend school. Frediana deals in selling clothes, a business she has done for 8 years as her major source of income.

Frediana relied on her business to meet her financial needs, but later she found out that her business alone cannot meet all of her financial needs. So  Frediana decided to join UGAFODE for financial assistance. She has been able to sustain her business and meet all of her financial obligations.

Frediana took this loan of 4,000,000 UGX to replenish her stock of clothes for her business to increase her sales during this festive season. She thanks UGAFODE for its financial assistance, which has enabled her to build a house, buy a piece of land, and be able to take her children to school.

Frediana thanks UGAFODE for the financial assistance it gives to low-income earners, which has helped to improve people’s standards of living. She encourages UGAFODE to continue supporting people.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married mother of four children. She describes herself as promising. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices of tailoring materials. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to own a large tailoring shop within five years.

loans.use: buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en:
Gambo is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Gambo joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Samaila, Nafiu and Bara'U.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Gambo would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Gambo can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Gambo spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda, es un mujer de 57 años de edad que desde hace algún tiempo se ha dedicado a diversas actividades laborales pero siempre con un deseo en su mente que era el incursionar en el área comercial, fue así como desde inicios del año 1984, monto su negocio ofreciendo elementos de cristalería y para el hogar, con el cual ha tenido gran acogida durante los años que lleva de funcionamiento. 

Amanda se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, amable, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por esta razón que se anima a solicitar un crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía como accesorios y elementos en cristalería y porcelana, con el fin de mejorar su inventario y darle una mejor imagen al negocio, que logre atraer más clientes y así ofrecerles una variedad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades y gustos de todos los que visiten el negocio. 

De esta manera logrará obtener ingresos para continuar aportando a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para montar varias sucursales de su negocio y así tendrá un futuro más próspero, donde podrá mejorar notoriamente su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Amanda is a 57-year-old woman who for some time worked at various jobs, but she was always looking toward the goal of trying her hand at running a commercial business. Thus, in early 1984, she started her business selling glassware and similar home decoration items. Her business has been well received during the years it has been operating.  

Amanda is characterized by her vision and desire to succeed, as well as her willingness to work hard and her cheerfulness. On this basis, she decided to ask for a loan to invest in buying more merchandise, such as crystal and porcelain accessories and elements, to improve her stock and the image of her business. She will be able to attract more clients by offering a variety of products that satisfy the needs and tastes of everyone who comes into her shop. 

In this way she can improve her income to continue contributing to her family’s living expenses and also save money to set up subsidiaries of her business and ensure a more prosperous future, improving in particular the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise, such as crystal and porcelain accessories and elements.

loans.name: Isaya

texts.en: Isaya is a married father of two children. He describes himself as dedicated. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a viable location and his primary customers are of all types. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. His business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is a married mother of two children. She describes herself as dedicated. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a viable location and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation costs. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items for sale in the retail shop

loans.name: Daysi Marisol

texts.es:
Daysi, de 39 años de edad, cursó hasta 2° grado de educación básica, debido a la situación económica que sus padres tenían, no pudo continuar sus estudios; es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, una estudia 3° año de bachillerato, la otra 6° grado, la penúltima hija 6° grado y el ultimo 4° grado. 

Daysi, se dedica a la agricultura, desde que tenia quince años, su padre no tuvo otra opción que enseñarle a
trabajar en la tierra, porque no tenia hermano varones que hicieran ese trabajo. 

Daysi, solicita el crédito para comprar tomates, chiles, cebollas, apio, manzanas, guineos, naranjas, uvas y otra parte la ocupará para pagar quien le corte la cosecha de maíz.
 
El sueño de Daysi, es poner un negocio en casa y poco a poco ampliarlo, para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Daysi is 39 years old and studied up to second year of Junior High school. Due to her parent's financial situation she couldn't continue to study.. She is a single mother with 4 children. One of them is studying in 3rd year of High school, two are in Grade 6 and the youngest is in Grade 4. Daysi has worked in agriculture since she was 15 years old. Her father had no other option but to teach her how to work the land as he had no male offspring to do this work.

Daysi is requesting a loan to buy tomatoes, chiles, onions, celery, apples, bananas and grapes and another part to pay for labor to harvest her corn crop. Daysi's dream is to install a business in her house, and little by little make it bigger to be able to provide her children with a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, chiles,onions, celery, apples, bananas and grapes and another part to pay for labor to harvest her corn.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic area. She says her biggest business challenge is lack of finances. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale farm.

loans.use: to buy more farm inputs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: In the year 2014, Gina learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Ozamiz City, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan for her rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Gina feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Gina wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Welma

texts.en: Welma is from Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 48 years of age. She and her partner have one school-aged child. Last year, 2014, she joined Paglaum MPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. From her desire to help the family, she engaged in selling chicken in different barangays in the municipality of Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Only her motorcycle was used as the source of transportation to reached the different barangays and sell chicken. Her source of income has existed for two years now. In need of additional working capital, she requested a financial assistance from Paglaum MPC: an amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase more stocks of chicken. Through this, she hopes to increase and/or have more income for she is able to provide for the daily needs of her family and also she is happy she can support the education of her children which is her main priority of her hardship.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of chicken for selling

loans.name: Michael Steven

texts.es:
Michael, de 21 años, inicio con un negocio de instalación de redes de internet hace aproximadamente 2 años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento, encuentra su motivación para trabajar incansablemente en sus padres y es así como desea ofrecerles lo mejor para su vida.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como cables, módems y herramientas de mano que le permitirán capitalizar su negocio y prestar un servicio de mejor calidad.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener los gastos en su hogar.

Apoya a Michael para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Michael, 21, started a business installing Internet networks about two years ago.  He wanted to find a job that would generate an income so he could survive.  Currently he's motivated to work tirelessly for his parents so he can give them the best in life.

He's requesting a loan to buy supplies such as cables, modems, and hand tools so he can invest in his business and offer higher quality service.

With this loan he'll be able to support the household expenses.

Help Michael so he can continue with his job!

loans.use: to buy supplies such as cables, modems, and hand tools

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Gwanki village in Kaduna state.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Ibrahim, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en: Kennedy is a married father of two children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells soft drinks, bread, and cakes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of soft drinks, bread, and cakes. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big 5-star hotel. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of soft drinks, bread, and cakes.

loans.name: Kalunda

texts.en: Kalunda is a single woman. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells onions. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are individuals. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of onions. This is her third  loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.She will use the anticipated profits to open more business branches to enable her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married mother of four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married mother of two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en: Zablon is a married father of five children. He describes himself as honest, determined. He operates a retail business where he sells maize flour, sugar, milk and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of maize flour, sugar and other items. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will open a wholesale business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank  His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Mildren

texts.en: Mildren is a widowed mother of five children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and handbags. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in season. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of handbags. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of handbags

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Business Administration. Here is his story:

“My goal is to get a high-quality education and acquit the expectations of my mother. Now thanks to this Kiva loan, I have an opportunity to get the best education in my country. Receiving this aid will allow me to continue making progress toward my goals. I think with the gained knowledge at AUCA I will be a smart, outstanding person and a good expert in this field.

"My family consists of two members: my mother and me. My mother is a single parent and teaches at one of the local universities. My mother always says me that education is a very important aspect in our life, and I do agree with her. I finished the Kyrgyz-Turkish High School for boys, where all subjects are taught in English. Since school I had a dream to get a degree at AUCA, because it supports broad-minded future leaders of Kyrgyzstan and helps to identify the potential skills of students and reach their goals.

"I am requesting the Kiva loan because my family needs support in paying my university tuition fee. I could enter AUCA passing its entering exams, and now I am closer to my dream: to get a degree in business administration. I am interested in exploring the world, looking for opportunities, and AUCA gives these possibilities. Moreover, I consider AUCA as a great place to get in touch with the interesting people, meeting new friends, and a net of good knowledge.”

loans.use: to pay for his higher education

loans.name: Idi

texts.en:
Idi is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Idi joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mustapha, Abas and Maru.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Idi would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Idi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Idi spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Joaquin tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y dos hijos. Él es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar a su familia lo necesario. Joaquin desea encementar el piso de la vivienda dado que actualmente el piso es de tierra y desea dar mejores condiciones habitacionales a su familia. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena y grava. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar inicio a las mejoras lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Joaquín, 43, lives in his own house with his wife and two children.  He's a very hardworking man who's devoted to his family and does everything in his control to give them what they need.

Joaquín wants to cement the floor of his house to give his family better living conditions, because the current floor is made of dirt.  He'll buy cement, sand, and gravel with the loan.

He hopes to be able to get this financing so he can begin with the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor of his home

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es:
Maria es madre responsable de un hijo e 8 años de edad; desde hace aproximadamente 11 meses se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, actividad que aprendió de manera empírica y que surgió de la necesidad de generar recursos para el sustento de su familia; ofrece todo tipo de productos como ropa, perfumería, cremas corporales, accesorios, entre otros y cuenta con la ventaja de que diariamente conoce nuevas personas a las que les puede ofrecer su mercancía, mejorando cada día sus ventas. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, zapatos, accesorios, perfumería, entre otros), así podrá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en esta temporada de fin de año; mejorando su nivel de ingresos.

Maria, con empeño y dedicación, desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, ya que para un futuro cercano, sueña con tener la posibilidad de montar un almacén en un local comercial donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos y que le genere una rentabilidad y una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su hijo una excelente educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is the responsible mother of a son who is 8 years old. For approximately the past 11 months, she has worked as an independent businesswoman, work that she learned empirically, and that arose from the need to generate resources to sustain her family. She sells all sorts of products such as clothing, perfume, body creams, and accessories, among others, and has the advantage that she meets new people every day to whom she can offer her merchandise, improving her sales every day. 

Currently, she is asking for the support of a loan to purchase merchandise in bulk (blouses, jeans, shoes, accessories, and perfumes, among others), and in this way she will be able to supply herself with more variety to satisfy the demand that has increased in this end-of-year season, improving her level of income. 

Maria, with determination and dedication, wants to continue working to get her business ahead since, in the near future, she dreams of having the possibility of establishing a shop in a retail space where she will be able to offer a wider variety of things and will generate profits and a favorable economic stability to give her son an excellent education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in bulk (blouses, jeans, shoes, accessories, perfumes, etc.)

loans.name: Beatrez

texts.en:
Beatrez is 48 years old with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Beatrez has been in this business for three years. In the future, Beatrez would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 36 years old and all of her children are in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Luzviminda has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Leidy Carolina

texts.es:
Leidy es una mujer dedicada a su familia y a su labor. Su tenacidad y perseverancia le han permitido salir adelante, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le han presentado. 

Desde hace 6 años inició su propio negocio, un salón de belleza que ubicó en un espacio de la casa donde reside, además, también presta el servicio a domicilio, según el requerimiento de sus clientes. 

Esto le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y a solventar las necesidades de su único hijo de 6 meses.

El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, shampoo, acondicionador, esmaltes para uñas, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y prestar un servicio más completo a sus clientes, de una manera más ágil y eficiente; lo que beneficiará el margen de utilidades que percibe por su labor. 

Leidy manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder continuar con su labor, acreditar y fortalecer bien su negocio para lograr ser más competitiva en el mercado y así tener la capacidad para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Leidy is dedicated to her family and her job.  Her tenacity and her perseverance have allowed her to make progress and overcome various obstacles that have come up.

She started her own business six years ago, a beauty salon in a space in her residence.  She also provides in-home service, depending on her customers' needs.  This has allowed her to generate enough income to help her husband with the financial burden of the household and to pay for the needs of her only child, a six-month-old.

Leidy's going to invest the loan in buying supplies wholesale (hair treatments, shampoo, conditioning, nail polish, among other items).  This will allow her to continue working and offer more complete, flexible, and efficient services to her customers, thus improving her profit margin.

Leidy said her biggest desire is to be able to keep on working, get recognition, and strengthen her business well so she's more competitive in the market.  That way she'll be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy hair treatments, shampoo, conditioning, nail polish, and other supplies

loans.name: Ali Dangwarta

texts.en:
Ali Dangwarta is a maize farmer from Gwanki village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ali he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ali Dangwarta can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Ali Dangwarta, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kotzij Group

texts.en:
The second largest city in Guatemala, Quetzaltenango (or Xela as locals lovingly refer to the municipality), sits in a valley high above sea level. More than half of the residents are of indigenous Mayan descent and demonstrate their extreme pride in their traditions and ancestry. In this city known as “the soul of culture,” seven businesswomen have formed the Trust Bank Kotzij in order to gain self-empowerment and provide better lives for their families through credit and education. 

Julia is one of the members of the Trust Bank. She is 50 years old and has two grown sons with her husband. Although Julia only attended four years of primary school, she is an astute businesswoman. This driven entrepreneur owns a convenience store in a small nearby village in which she sells packaged food items and beverages. The majority of her customers are from her community and the surrounding area. Julia currently has one employee who assists her in the store, allowing her to spend some time with her family. With the new loan, she plans to purchase additional products to keep up with demand and a machine to make homemade frozen fruit popsicles, something she enjoys doing. 

Like Julia, the businesswomen are eager to continue improving their businesses and providing better lives for their families. The members gain new information about nutrition and health, business management and self-esteem during the monthly meetings with a Friendship Bridge credit agent. Through this informal education, the women discover their own potential and take charge of their lives, sharing their wealth of knowledge with their families and other members of their communities. 

The members of the Kotzij Trust Bank are thankful for the generosity of Kiva investors in helping the women accomplish their dreams. They are excited to work towards a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to keep up with demand and a machine to make homemade frozen fruit popsicles

loans.name: Julio Javier

texts.es:
Julio es un hombre  de 33 años, casado, tiene un hijo varón de 8 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de zapatos de cholita (mujer tradicional, usa sombrero, manta y pollera).
Él es emprendedor, independiente, de buen trato, sociable, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el ‘cruce villa Adela’ un lugar céntrico, caracterizado por conectar a varias zonas de la ciudad mediante el transporte público, desde este lugar se puede conseguir transporte a zonas alejadas de la ciudad, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-12 grados centígrados durante todo el año y a una altura de 3800 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Julio es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su negocio es la fabricación de zapatos de cholita (mujer tradicional, usa sombrero, manta y pollera). Empezó su trabajo como costurero de zapatos, posteriormente se especializó en zapatos de cholita, sus creaciones son originales, elabora zapatos a pedido y para grupos folclóricos de baile. Los pedidos que tiene los entrega por mayor en su propio automóvil que es su herramienta de trabajo. Este automóvil se encuentra averiado por lo que tiene que contratar taxi y eso le ocasiona mayores gastos. Su sueño es ampliar su taller. Él desea reparar su automóvil para realizar las entregas de forma puntual. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamo con la institución en 3 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Julio solicita un préstamo para la reparación de su automóvil y realizar las entregas de sus zapatos a tiempo.
texts.en:
Julio is 33 years old, married and has an 8-year-old son. His business is fabricating cholita shoes. He is entrepreneurial, independent, well-mannered, social, responsible and hard-working.
His business is located at the "Cruce Villa Adela", a central area characterized by public transport connections to most areas of the city, including the more remote ones. The city's climate is cold and dry with a day temperature that varies between 4 and 12 Celsius all year round, at a height of 3800 meters above sea level.
Julio has a dark complexion, short black hair and is of low height. His native language is Aymara but he also speaks Spanish to comply with the general culture and for his business, making cholita (traditional bolivian women that wear hats, shawls and skirts) shoes.
He began as regular shoemaker and later specialized in the fabrication of cholita shoes. His creations are innovative and he prepares the shoes on demand and for folkloric dance groups.
He delivers the ordered shoes in his car, which is thus one of his working tools. This car, however, is damaged and he therefore has to resolve to taking taxis, which result in higher costs.
He dreams of expanding his shoemakers shop. He also hopes to repair his car so that he can deliver the orders on time.
This is the first sequence of loans that Julio asks of Kiva in the past three years that he has been establishing his business.
For these reasons Julio is asking for a loan to repair his car and thus carry out his shoe deliveries on time.

loans.use: to repair his car and thus deliver his shoes on time.

loans.name: Ddc Group

texts.en:
Bijeli, who is in her late 40s, is divorced with four adult children. She is also living with four grandchildren.  She has been a food vendor for 12 years now.  She works from 7 a.m. to midnight daily and is able to make good monthly profit.

This will be Bijeli's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start selling beer, soda, water and kibuku (local brew). She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is really doing great with the loans and appreciates Kiva for the support of her group. She used the profit to buy a plot of land and to cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to restock items in the food store, and to buy beer, soda, Kibuku (local brew ) and water to resell at her mama lishe (cafe). She dreams of building a good house.

Bijeli will share this loan with her loan group "Ddc" which has a total of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the food store and to buy beer, soda, Kibuku (local brew) and water to resell at her mama lishe (cafe).

loans.name: Dockers Group

texts.en:
Shiza, who is in her mid 30s, is a single mother of two children who are still at school.  She has been a food vendor for 15 years now.  She works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Shiza's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, flour, beans, sugar and charcoal for cooking.  She dreams of owning a hotel.  

Shiza will share this loan with her loan group "Dockers," which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, flours, beans, sugar and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en: Marvin is 22 years old, single and lives with his parents in Bolinsong, Bonifacio. To earn a living, Marvin has a business that involves motor for hire or public transport. He does this work, helping his parents sustain their family needs. Marvin wants to repair their house for a decent and comfortable living space. He has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase plywood, nails, sticks and nipa thatch. Marvin is a new member of PMPC. In the future, he hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, sticks and nipa thatch

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila is managing her eatery business in Ozamiz City.This business has been doing well, supporting the needs of her family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be more happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. She has a business producing school uniforms and mending clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive.
She applied for a loan to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to improve her tailoring services.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies

loans.name: Dúo Elohim Group

texts.es:
Duo elohim 
Maritza es casada tiene una hija la cual asiste al colegio cercano a su comunidad, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de limpieza para el hogar el cual inicio hace cinco años cuando dejo de laborar para una empresa y decidió dedicarse a su hija, se siente muy satisfecha ya que gracias a su negocio puede obtener una ayuda económica y cuidar a su hija, anhela ver a su hija con un nivel de estudios alto, agradece a Dios la bendición de poder tener salud y salir adelante,esta solicitando este credito  para la compra de productos de limpieza para vender.
texts.en: Elohim group - Maritza is married and has a daughter who attends a school near her community. She works selling household cleaning supplies, which she began five years ago when she stopped working for a business and decided to focus on her daughter. She feels very satisfied because, thanks to her business, she was able to get economic support and care for her daughter. She wants to see her daughter with a high level of education, and thanks God for the blessing of being able to have health and get ahead. She is asking for this loan to purchase cleaning products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning supplies to sell.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Her name is Maxima. She is 49 and a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, her business partner, and has children. She and her husband work hard to meet their daily household needs and for the schooling of her children.

Maxima has a food business. She is a "mami" vendor. Mami is a popular Filipino dish of noodles made from fresh eggs; chicken, pork or beef; and broth. It can be eaten for lunch, dinner or snacks, especially in the cold months. In the Philippines, a food vendor is a common sight, especially in populated areas. Maxima cooks well, and that is why her mami is popular in their area with neighbors and the local working community as her regular customers. Aside from her food business, she also also buys and sells scraps and metals at her junk shop. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 net income a day.

To help her maintain her businesses, Maxima is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan to buy ingredients like pork, fish, chicken, seasonings, and egg noodles that she needs for cooking mami. She will use part of the loan to pay for scraps and metals to sell. She is thanking God in advance for the financial help that will surely cover their everyday needs and schooling of her children. She wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Maxima dreams of having a small eatery to expand her business. She wants to secure the education of her children and see them become professionals. She meets up with her fellowship group* every week to share stories of her life and business and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for ingredients such as chicken, egg noodles, seasoning and veggies, to cook and sell mami noodles.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es: Don Leónidas, tiene 49 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa y reside en una aldea del Municipio del Negrito, Yoro junto a una hija. El siempre trabajó como jornal en la agricultura. Ahora lleva 4 años de tener su propio negocio de compra y venta de naranjas para jugo. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante ofreciendo el producto en la misma comunidad y sus alrededores con su vehículo. Esta solicitando otro prestamo por 5,000 lempiras siendo el tercer ciclo con la institución, lo que le ha ayudado a mantener su negocio. Con el prestamo va comprar más naranjas para vender. Su plan es tener siempre esta actividad que le genere ingresos.
texts.en:
Leónidas, 49, lives in a common-law relationship with his wife.  He lives with a daughter in a village in the municipality of Negrito, Yoro.

He always worked as a day laborer in agriculture.  He has had his own business for four years now, buying and selling oranges for juice.  He does this as a street vendor, selling his product in the same community and the surrounding areas with his vehicle.

Leónidas is requesting another loan for 5,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy more oranges to sell.  This is his third loan cycle with the institution, which has helped him run his business.

His plan is to always have this income-generating job.

loans.use: to buy oranges to sell

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Luz de 30 años de edad, se ha ganado el cariño de todos sus vecinos por su amabilidad y buen sentido del humor. Ama su familia, la cual es el motor principal para luchar cada día y generar el sustento para sobrevivir. 

Aunque no contaba con recursos para iniciar su negocio, esto no fue impedimento para cumplir su sueño de convertirse en comerciante, con un pequeño capital, esta mujer inició con un negocio de tienda de abarrotes y legumbreria.

Sus sueños no paran, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de estanterías para ubicar sus productos y hacerlos más visibles y atractivos a sus clientes, además comprara surtido de productos de la canasta familiar y legumbres para abastecer su negocio y mejorar su inventario.

Espera poder mejorar su condición económica, poder tener una vejez sin preocupaciones monetarias y garantizarle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Luz, 30 years old, has earned the affection of all her neighbors due to her friendliness and good sense of humor. She loves her family, which is her driving force to struggle each day and generate the sustenance to survive. 

Although she didn't have the resources to start her business, this wasn't an impediment to achieve her dream of becoming a businesswoman. With a little capital, this woman began with a business of a grocery and vegetable store. 

Her dreams don't stop, and for this reason she is asking for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of shelves to place her products and make them more visible and attractive to her customers. In addition, she will purchase a variety of staple products and vegetables to stock her business and improve her inventory.

She hopes to be able to improve her economic situation, to be able to have an old age without financial worries, and guarantee a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase shelves to place her products and make them more visible.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajadora, así es Angela, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Bello, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos en un pequeño restaurante ubicado en su casa.

Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su restaurante porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.

Angela ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para comprar ingredientes e insumos para sus recetas.

Este préstamo le permitirá abastecerse con todos los ingredientes necesarios y podrá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Humble and hardworking, this is Angela, a fighter who has dedicated a large part of her life to the care of her children. She lives in the municipality of Bello, where she earns her living with the preparation of a variety of foods such as lunches and breakfasts in a small restaurant located in her house.

Her dishes are known by the neighbors in her sector, who visit her restaurant because they know that they will be able to eat deliciously.

Angela has decided to improve her business and expand her sales, for this reason she asks for a loan to purchase ingredients and supplies for her recipes.

This loan will allow her to supply herself with all the necessary ingredients and she will be able to get her business ahead to, in this way, get the income that will give her the opportunity to continue sustaining her family and her business. 

Help this woman with a loan and make her dreams come true!

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies for her recipes.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 37 years old and married with three children who attend school.  She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Carmelita has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items.  In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 42 years old and married with seven children. With six children in school, Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

Lorna runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 2 years. Lorna requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc..

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 66 years old and married, with one child in school. Angela works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Angela has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Hamisu

texts.en:
Hamisu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hamisu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Hamisu expressed a desire to use the extra income to build a better home, and in the long run, ensure his children: Imurana, Zakary and Maryam are educated and have access to professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mahammadu Kamsisi

texts.en:
Mahammadu Kamsisi is a maize farmer from Kankanki village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mahammadu Kamsisi can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Mahammadu Kamsisi, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix just purchased a 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester. He was mostly interested in this state-of-the-art installation because it turns his animals' manure into a crucial resource for his farm and house: biogas. He is proud to serve as an example in the community and to show the opportunity biodigesters represent to transform what is commonly seen as waste into a precious resource. In addition, the biodigester allows him to dramatically reduce the operating costs of his farm, since he won't have to buy the expensive propane anymore. 
This loan represents 45% of the total cost of the Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 41 years old and married with four children who are in school. Lorna works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, chocolates, canned goods, etc.

She has been in this business for six years.  In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, chocolates, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 57 years old now. Clarita has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Clarita has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with six children. She is 47 years old and has one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Sarah has a food vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 6 years. Sarah requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw products and ingredients for her business.

In the future, Sarah would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw products and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with two children. She is 33 years old and her two children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.
