Gina has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Iva

texts.en:
Iva is a 30-year-old woman and has two children, who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Iva has a used-clothing "buy-and-sell" business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional used clothing to sell.

Iva has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothing to sell

loans.name: Arcelia

texts.en:
Arcelia is 46 years old and has five children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Arcelia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Arcelia has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed from NWTF six times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alvaro Alexander

texts.es: Alvaro es un joven de nacionalidad colombiana, el vive con su tía, Alvaro trabaja al jornal de actividades de agricultura y a la crianza de animales menores, adicionalmente o cuando hay la ocasión se va a trabajar de chofer, este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, la aspiración de Alvaro es de  mejorar su negocio y seguir trabajando para pagar todos los gastos que tiene a diario.
texts.en:
Alvaro is a young Columbian man, who lives with his aunt. Alvaro works as an agricultural day laborer and breeds domesticated animals. Additionally, whenever there is the demand, Alvaro also works as a driver.

Alvaro is asking for the loan to buy pigs. He aspires to improve his business and to continue working so as to be able to cover his daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 38 years old and married with five children.

Lina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Lina has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like eggs, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Luz Francely

texts.es:
Luz es madre de 4 hijos entre los 7 y 14 años y vive en unión libre. Aparte de su familia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años. 

Aprendió de este negocio empíricamente, es decir a través de la práctica y la observación de otras personas. Ella y su familia viven en zona rural de Sonson en la cual no es fácil tener acceso a servicios financieros como los que ofrece la Corporación Interactuar. 

Su crédito lo piensa usar en la compra de insumos agropecuarios como semillas de papa criolla, productos para el control de plagas, y abonos para realizar mantenimiento y sostenimiento a sus cultivos.

Gracias a este crédito, la economía y  calidad de vida de su familia mejoraría pues podrá aumentar sus ingresos. 

Luz sueña terminar con la legalización de los papeles de su tierra y así tener en pleno el control de sus tierras.

 ¡Impacte la vida de Luz y su familia con un crédito!
texts.en:
Luz is the mother of 4 children between the ages of 7 and 14, and lives in a common-law marriage. Apart from her family, she has worked in agriculture for 10 years.

She learned this business empirically, which is to say through practice and observing other people. She and her family live in the rural zone of Sonson, where it is not easy to have access to financial services like those that the Corporación Interactuar offers.

She plans to use her loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as creole potato seeds, products to control pests, and manure to maintain and sustain her crops. 

Thanks to this loan, her family's economy and quality of life will improve since it will increase her income. 

Luz dreams of being able to finish the legal process of the land title and in this way have full control of her land. 

Impact Luz and her family's life with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as creole potato seeds, and products to control pests.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis, un hombre de 24 años de edad lleno de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en una finca en el municipio de Amaga y se gana la vida con la producción y venta de pollos y huevos.  

Con este trabajo intenta sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposa y su hijo.

Es un trabajo que ha venido ejerciendo desde hace aproximadamente 1 año con el fin de salir adelante.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, gallinas ponedoras, alimento y materiales para su galpón.

Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más sostenible y consolidado.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Luis!
texts.en:
Luis, age 24, is full of dreams and aspirations for his life.  He lives on a farm in the Amaga municipality, and he earns a living producing and selling chickens and eggs.

With this work he tries to support his family, which is comprised of his wife and his son.  He has been doing this work for approximately one year in order to get ahead.

He is asking for financial help to buy chickens, laying hens, feed, and materials for his hen house.  With this loan he will be able to have a stronger and more sustainable business.

With a loan that you make now you will be able to improve Luis’s life and his business.

loans.use: to buy chickens, laying hens, feed, and materials for his hen house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a website for his business so that he can acquire new customers.

loans.name: Umaru Bitrus

texts.en:
Umaru Bitrus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona.  He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ibrahim, Zakaria and Yusuf.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Umaru Bitrus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Umaru Bitrus spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a maize farmer from Barau village in Kaduna state.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samuel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Samuel, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell maize at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tiles, poles and cement to renew the roof of his house.

loans.name: Macelinda

texts.en: Macelinda is a businesswoman who earns through her piggery business. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She has two children with ages 2 years and 5 years. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail shop where she makes charcoal. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular. 

Gladys describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Wencerica

texts.en: In 2013, Wencerica learned about Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. Wencerica tried her luck with farming activities. She feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Wencerica borrowed another amount to pay for seedlings and compost. This will give her rice farming production income a big boost. Wencerica looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Maveth

texts.en:
Maveth is 27 years old and lives in Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is single with one child who is now of school age.
 
Maveth earns income from dealing in cosmetic products and ready-to-wear clothing. She’s been engaged in this business for 4 years already. She is also receiving support from her live-in partner who is a motorcycle driver.  She earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of business activity, and that amount is so helpful to support her family's needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stocks of cosmetics and ready-to-wear clothing for sale.
 
Maveth has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Maveth hopes to open a little boutique to display all of her products.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of cosmetics and ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Rosa Neira

texts.es:
Rosa, una adorable, humilde y trabajadora abuelita de 58 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de artesanías en lana, gorros, bufandas, bolsos, manillas y varios artículos que ella misma elabora en su hogar.
Lo más bonita de esta profesión es que la aprendió de una hija e hizo de esa enseñanza una oportunidad de negocio y quiere mejorar, sus ventas aumentar sus clientes, ella sueña con tener un local comercial, aumentar su inventario comprar una casa, sueños locos que con el pasar del tiempo se van volviendo cuerdos. 
Solicita un crédito para comprar lana y materiales para la elaboración de correas, bufandas, billeteras etc., una nueva línea que de seguro le atraerá un mejor volumen de interesados.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 58, is an adorable, humble, and hard-working grandmother.  She sells handicrafts in wool, hats, scarves, bags, bracelets, and various items that she makes herself at home.

The beauty of this profession is that she learned it from a girl, and she turned this teaching into a business opportunity.  She wants to improve her sales and get more customers.  She dreams of having a commercial place, increasing her inventory, and buying a house.  These are crazy dreams that, in time, are becoming realistic.

She is requesting a loan to buy wool and materials to make belts, scarves, and wallets, etc.  A new line will surely attract a better volume of interested customers.

loans.use: to buy wool and materials to make belts, scarves, and wallets, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, soy sauce, vinegar, beverages, and other groceries.

Gina has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from being a load retailer.

Gina aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like canned goods, soy sauce, vinegar, beverages, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 50 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for her daily needs.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like school supplies, beverages, canned goods, and other groceries.

Rosita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like school supplies, beverages, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 54 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, condiments, canned goods and other groceries, etc.

Cecilia has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, condiments, canned goods and other groceries, etc.

loans.name: Maria Angelita

texts.es: Maria es una señora de 63 años de edad, ella es muy responsable en todas sus actividades, ella esta casada y tiene 7 hijos mismos de los cuales 1 vive con ella, el crédito o va a invertir en la compra de semilla, abono y fungicidas ya que junto a su esposo se dedican a sembrar sus cultivos de los productos propios de su comunidad, la aspiración de Maria en de seguir trabajando y tener sanos a sus cultivos para su bienestar y el de su familia.
texts.en: María, 63, is a lady who is very responsible in all of her activities.  She is married with 7 children, one of whom lives with her. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of seed, fertilizer, and fungicide, as she and her husband grow crops that are typical of their community.  María aspires to keep working and having healthy crops for the wellbeing of her family and herself.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 71 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Anita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Anita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Anita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Arriza

texts.en:
Arriza works hard to support her family. Arriza is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for boat repair such as plywood, paint, bamboo, etc.

Arriza has been in this business for 23 years now.

In the future, Arriza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to materials for boat repair such as plywood, paint, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Yan Gwari village in Kaduna state.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Ibrahim, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell maize at low prices at harvest

loans.name: Andrés

texts.en:
Andrés owns around 150 hogs and a few other animals on his farm, that produce important amounts of previously useless and contaminating manure. 

With his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, Andrés will have the opportunity to transform this waste into a productive resource, producing his own biogas and organic fertilizer, leading to economic savings as well as health benefits and a reduced carbon footprint for his farm. Indeed, the methane-rich biogas produced in the biodigester will allow him to supply his home and farm with the necessary renewable energy to cook and heat water and to displace the expensive LP gas. 

Since he also cultivates corn for which he used to buy chemical fertilizers, Andres will save money and protect his soil by replacing petrochemical fertilizer by the potent biofertilizer, thereby increasing the yield of his corn in a natural way. His farm will become more productive, respect natural cycles, and reduce its dependency on external inputs and fossil fuels, while reducing operating expenses.

This loan represents 50% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a biodigester for his farm.

loans.name: Gaukhar

texts.en:
Gaukhar is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Comparative Politics. Here is her story:

“I am thankful to my mother, who had taken me far away to her home town, where I was able to get a good knowledge in a wonderful school where the way of teaching students was special and unusual. We had a lot of both local and foreign teachers from the USA and Britain. Since High School I had a dream to study abroad or to enter the American University in Central Asia, which is located in Bishkek.

I came to Bishkek from Karakol town, which is the capital of the Issyk-Kul region of Kyrgyzstan. My town is popular also due to the Issyk-Kul Lake, what we call “the gem of Kyrgyzstan”. We have a lot of tourists from different parts of the world in summer and in winter for skiing.

I live with my mother and brother. When I was 3 years old my father left us and my mother raised us alone. My mother works in Uzbekistan and comes to visit us rarely; me and my brother stay in Karakol. He hasn’t a high education and doesn’t have a permanent job. Usually he is a taxi-driver. Sometimes he is a waiter in restaurants. He does his best in order to help my mother and help me to study at AUCA. I believe that AUCA will open new doors for me in the future and with the help of them I can gain my goals and be confident of my and my family’s future. I thank all Kiva lenders for their generosity and attention.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is an entrepreneur who has been running a beauty salon for more than five years. She wants to repaint it and buy new parts and products. She lives at the end of the salon's hall with her daughter. She wants a loan to improve the lounge area with new equipment and make the facade more beautiful.

She needs the loan because some of their devices are borrowed and she needs to stock products. She believes that making the salon's facade more beautiful and adding a sign with the business's name and the services it offers will help it to increase the number of customers.

loans.use: to buy a mirror, hair products, botox, dryer and chairs, and to paint the facade

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Rosa Angelica es un estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder terminar sus estudios, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Rosa Angélica, tengo 20 años de edad, nací y me crie con mis Padres y mis dos hermanos, que son también estudiantes universitarios al igual que yo. Mi padre es pensionado y mi madre es maestra de educación básica.
Soy estudiante de medicina en el Instituto Tecnológico de Santo Domingo (INTEC) y elegí esta carrera porque es lo que he deseado desde muy pequeña, ya sé que es una gran responsabilidad pero siempre me ha gustado ayudar a las personas y solo por el hecho de tratar de salvarle la vida a otro ser humano creo que merece la pena todos los años de estudios que hay que dedicar.
Estoy solicitando este préstamo para poder finalizar mis estudios, ya que con mucho sacrificio he cursado la mayoría de mis trimestres pero ya las cosas se han dificultado mucho porque los ingresos de mis padres se han visto más afectados por la situación económica que estamos atravesando en mi hogar, y esto me está impidiendo poder concluir la universidad cuando apenas me faltan 8 trimestres.
Espero que me puedan aprobar este préstamo para así poder finalizar mis estudios y alcanzar mi meta que es convertirme en doctora, para después que termine hacer una especialidad en cirugía cardiovascular  que es lo que me gusta; con el tiempo espero tener un buen trabajo en el sector de la salud para poder estabilizarme y tener una familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Angélica is in medical school.  She's requesting a loan to be able to finish her studies.  This is her story:

"My name is Rosa Angélica.  I'm 20 years old.  I was born and raised with my parents and my two siblings, who are also college students like me.  My father's retired and my mother's an elementary-school teacher.

"I'm in medical school at the Instituto Tecnológico de Santo Domingo (INTEC) and I chose this field because it's what I've wanted since I was a little girl.  I know it's a big responsibility, but I've always enjoyed helping people and I think it's worth all the years you have to devote to it for the mere fact of trying to save another human being's life.

"I'm requesting this loan to be able to finish my studies, because I've finished most of my trimesters with a lot of hard work.  Things have gotten difficult now, though, because my parents' income has been very affected by the financial situation at home right now.  This is preventing me from being able to finish college when I have barely only eight trimesters left.

"I hope you can approve me for this loan so I can complete my studies and achieve my goal of becoming a doctor so when I'm done I can specialize in cardiovascular surgery, which is what I enjoy.  In time I hope to have a good job in the health sector so I can settle down and have a family."

loans.use: to cover her higher education expenses

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer from Chiroma village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Samaila, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to expand his farmland, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dalhatu

texts.en:
Dalhatu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Dalhatu is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Luntha Group

texts.en:
Memory, age 32, supports her family by selling different kinds of commodities in her grocery. Memory is a mother of six children and she keeps two orphans. She started this business in order to support her family and to pay medical bills for her children. 

She will use the loan to expand her business by buying more commodities, in order to increase her profits, and this will help to overcome the challenges that her family has been facing. Her main goal is to have a wholesale, and she dreams of sending her children to better schools. The profits from the previous loan have helped her to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel raises and sells hogs to support the needs of his family. He is a 30-year-old, married man with three young children living in Mcarthur, Leyte.  To augment additional income, he engages in a food vending business. He has been engaged in this kind of business for five years now.

He is in need of capital to sustain his present livelihood.  Arnel is asking for a loan to purchase additional piglets, pig feed and additional capital for his food vending business. In the coming months, Arnel could raise and sell more healthy hogs. He could have a capital to start his food vending business.  Because of these, his earnings will improve, and he will be able to afford to buy nutritious foods for the whole family.

He is hoping that someday, both of his businesses will prosper to support the needs of his growing children, to finance college educations for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, pig feed and additional capital for his food vending business.

loans.name: Bainomugisa Group

texts.en:
Sharon is a hard working woman living in Kagadi Uganda, married with 1 child. She gets her income from her job, she is a laboratory technician, and from farming.

Sharon is challenged by price fluctuations hindering her dream of business growth. She is asking for credit to buy laboratory materials for her laboratory.

She is a member of Bainomugisa Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy materials for her laboratory.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Iliya joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Amos, Grace and Laraba.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Iliya spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kabiru

texts.en:
Kabiru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Kabiru joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yakubu and Zad.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Kabiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Kabiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

When asked, Kabiru spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for child school fees and uniforms; eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Abba

texts.en:
Abba is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ignatius, Elkana and Numfa.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, he would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abba can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Abba spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jose Arley

texts.es:
Jose, a sus 45 años de edad, es un hombre carismático, activo y servicial. 

Ser padre de dos hijos, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y llevar el sustento a sus hijos. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 3 años, comenzó a comercializar calzado para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector y lograr una buena trayectoria. 

Esto lo impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer sus inventarios, pues comprará calzado al por mayor, así podrá satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en esta temporada navideña, esto le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Jose manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir haciendo lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en un gran distribuidor de calzado y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar tanto de su familia, como la de aquellas personas que le ayuden a realizar su labor diaria.

Anímate a prestar al negocio de Jose!
texts.en:
Jose, at 45 years of age, is a charismatic, dynamic and obliging person.

Being the father of two children has been the principal motivation for him to work tirelessly day after day to find ways to earn a living and provide for his kids. 

For approximately three years now he has been selling shoes for all types of clients, with very high quality at excellent prices. This has given him a good reputation in his sector and allowed for strong development.  

It has also led him to ask for support in the form of a loan to increase his inventory. He will buy shoes in bulk, and thus satisfy the growing demand during the Christmas season. This will enable him to increase the earnings he makes from his labor. 

Jose underlined that his age doesn’t stop him from doing what he is passionate about, and for this reason he is always setting new goals. Among them is the desire to become an important distributor of shoes and generate job opportunities, in this way improving the quality of life and well being for himself and his family, and also for all the people who help him to carry out his daily work. 

Join in by helping Jose improve his business!

loans.use: to buy shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Luis Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Luis tiene gran experiencia en el área de restaurantes, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propio Restaurante que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para realizar adecuaciones a su local ya que este necesita algunas reformas para continuar funcionando además necesita comprar insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos.

El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran restaurante en el cual pueda atender a muchos clientes.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada teniendo en cuenta que para este tipo de negocios se necesitan algunas condiciones especiales.
texts.en:
Luis has a lot of experience in the restaurant field.  He started his own restaurant some time ago and it has generated good results from him up to now.  He has always preferred to work on his own.  He works from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day.

Currently Luis needs some help to make some modifications and repairs to his space to stay in business.  He also needs to buy ingredients to make his dishes.

The loan will allow him to work on better conditions and will ensure the quality of his dishes.  With this help he'll be able to work in a more organized fashion, keeping in mind that special conditions are needed for this type of business.

His biggest dream is to be able to have a great restaurant where he can serve a lot of customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make his dishes

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is a 60 year-old-farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has nine grown children. Agapita has been in the rice farming business for more than 30 years. She helps and supports her husband in tilling their farm.
Agapita would like to take a loan from CEVI, a microfinance institution that allows small entrepreneurs like her to borrow a loan for the business. A loan will be used to buy seed and fertilizers for the farm. This will enable her to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her profit and income. In the future, Agapita hopes of making her business grow.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Emielyn

texts.en:
Emielyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emielyn is 36 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Emielyn has a peanut-butter-making business in the Philippines. Emielyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like peanuts, oil, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

Emielyn has been in this business for 5 years.  

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like peanuts, oil, sugar, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 53 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Cristina has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina works hard to support her family. Divina is married and has a retail gasoline business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell.

Divina has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Martillana

texts.en:
Martillana is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Martillana is 56 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Martillana requested a PHP 30000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Martillana has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Martillana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Koengleang

texts.en: Koengleang, a local resident from Kampong Cham province, is 55 years old and a mother of thirteen children. For her living she grows rice as a single source of her income. This is first time for Koengleang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to pay for the labor fees to build a new house. She hopes that she can improve her family condition better than before.

loans.use: To pay labor fees to build a new house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 54 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school, Elvie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a retail gasoline business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional containers of diesel and gasoline to sell.

Elvie has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Elvie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of diesel and gasoline to sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jennifer has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 25 years old and married with one child and she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Mariam has been in this business for 6 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is a hog farmer, who raises pigs and sells them for their meat. In addition to his work on the farm, he is a lawyer and has a few clients in his community. Nonetheless, he finds it sometimes hard to cope with the increasing prices of LP gas, and decided to invest in a biodigester to reduce his operating costs and turn his farm into a more sustainable place. Indeed, his hogs' manure are emitting greenhouse gases, contaminating underground water sources and attracting swarms of flies through the bad smells. By inputting the waste in the biodigester, he will produce his own biogas to cook and heat water in the house, as well as a potent organic fertilizer for the plot of land where he cultivates corn. In addition to displacing the fossil fuel based LP gas, he will also eliminate chemical fertilizers, which damage his soils, to improve the productivity of his field in a natural way. His quality of life, carbon footprint and available income will increase through his investment in this waste-to-energy technology.
This loan represents 50% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 16 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a young hog farmer, who decided to purchase a large Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to reduce his operating costs (which mostly consist of LP gas and chemical fertilizers), while protecting the environment. From now on, he will be able to use his pigs' manure as a productive resource and transform it into methane-rich biogas connected to the house to cook and heat water with renewable energy. In addition, the bacteria inside the biodigester produce a potent organic fertilizer, which will nourish the soils with nutrients, improving the quality and productivity of his corn field in a natural way. Roberto will displace the LP gas and chemical fertilizers by treating his animals' waste, thereby avoiding unnecessary greenhouse gas emissions and turning his farm into a sustainable place, where fossil fuels are no longer necessary, and the environment is protected.
This loan represents 50% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 40 m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Ranulfo

texts.en:
Ranulfo is a small dairy farmer, who lives from selling his cows' milk and the corn he cultivates on a field a few kilometers away from his house. He decided to invest in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester in order to displace the expensive and fossil fuel based LP gas from his milk production activity. Indeed, by producing his own biogas through the treatment of his cows' manure, he will drastically reduce his operating costs and earn more money on the sale of his milk. In addition to the biogas, the biodigester also produces a nutrient-rich organic fertilizer that Ranulfo will spread on his corn field, replacing the unsustainable chemical fertilizers to increase his crops' yield in a natural way. As his productivity improves, he will earn more by saving money and protecting the environment. Ranulfo is proving that a sustainable and fossil fuel-free dairy farm is possible, in a region where most farmers live from selling their cows' milk.
This loan represents 10% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 20 m3 waste-to-energy biodigester.

loans.name: Sountéré1 Group

texts.fr:
Sountéré1 est formé de 8 femmes dynamiques qui exercent dans plusieurs domaine d'activités.Elles prennent le crédit avec ACFIME depuis Mai 2011 et jusque là, les remboursements ne posent pas de problème.Elles sont à leur 10ème prêt.
Kadidia, membre représentatif est couturière, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter son matériel de couture composé de fil de différentes couleurs, de la paupiline pour doubler les habits, des boutons ,des fermetures, des ciseaux et autre matériel nécessaire pour sa couture. les bénéfices serviront a continuer l'activité et à subvenir au besoin de sa famille.
texts.en: Sountéré1 is made up of 8 dynamic women who carry out many different activities.  They have taken  loans with ACFIME since May 2011 and so far, repayments have not posed any problems.  They are on their 10th loan.  Kadidia, member representative, is a dressmaker, married and mother of 6 children.  She needs this loan to buy her sewing materials, composed of thread in different colours, poplin to line clothes, buttons, fasteners, scissors and other materials necessary for her dressmaking.  The income will serve to continue the business and to meet the needs of her family

loans.use: to buy sewing materials (needles, thread, fasteners, buttons, . . .)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soles, stones to create some of her products, spinning lines and glue to make shoes

loans.name: Rosario Angelica

texts.en:
Rosario Angelica is a young farmer who is very interested in environmental technologies allowing to work in a more cost-efficient way, while turning the farm into a sustainable place. She invested in her biodigester to displace the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers, which she will replace by the biogas and biofertilizer produced from her cows' and sheep's manure. The biodigester allows her to transform a problem (piles of animal waste) into a solution and productive resources to improve her productivity, while respecting natural cycles and eliminating the need for fossil fuel based energy and fertilizers. The piles of waste will no longer attract flies and generate bad smells, nor contaminate underground water sources. Rosario Angelica will spread the nutrient-rich and organic fertilizer on her corn field, increasing her crops' yield and quality in a natural way. With the savings she makes, she plans to buy more cows and sheep to expand her farm.
This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra has engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 20 years now. She is 53 years old, with one dependent. She hails from MacArthur, Leyte. To have an additional source of income, she farms, growing and selling rice.
 
She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and farm supplies like fertilizers and medicines and to pay for laborers. These things are very essential in improving her yield and in generating more harvest. In the coming months, Alejandra and her family will be raising healthy hogs. With these changes, she could earn a higher income and afford to provide a proper diet for the whole family. She could start to repay her loan and other household expenses.

She dreams of expanding her business in the future to make it more productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and farm supplies like fertilizers and medicines and to pay for laborers

loans.name: Marcia

texts.en:
Marcia sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional grocery products needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expense of her children and pay for their daily needs.

Marcia is very positive that she can improve more her business if you will lend her an amount of 10,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward additional stocks of groceries, toiletries and beverages. Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result for her business to become viable and sustainable. She will also use a portion of the loan to buy raw ingredients and supplies which she needs in her food stall business. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family.

Marcia wishes to have her own stall in the market so that she can attract more customers. She wants that her family is always strong and healthy. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy more store inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a mother to ten children, six of them are already adults while four are still dependents, aged four to eighteen.

Twenty eight years ago, Elizabeth started investing in a fishing business with her husband in order to support her children. In addition to this, she also buys and sells fish for a living. She is asking a loan of 25000 PHP to buy a new engine for the fishing boat and to use as an additional capital to buy more fish. 

In the future, Elizabeth hopes to manage her business well for sustainability.

loans.use: buy a boat engine & fish to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a 53-year-old married woman and mother of four grown-up children from Trinidad, Bohol. She operates a small sari-sari or retail store business,  selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood. Flora has been in this business for several years now. 

Flora is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, sodas and beverages, bread and biscuits, cooking oil and condiments. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stocks which will attract more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Flora hopes to make her store more stable and productive.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a sari-sari (variety) store owner from Carles, Iloilo. She is 34 years old. She started her sari-sari store business two years ago. In her store, she sells items like canned goods, candies, chips, bath soap, detergent, shampoo and seasoning. She is asking for a loan of 25000 PHP to buy additional items to sell in her store, such as snack food, coffee,  beverages and toiletries. In the future, Jane dreams of making her business a success and to help her parents live a life in abundance.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Buseesa Farmers Group

texts.en: Jesca a married lady and earns a living from selling alcohol and farming in Kagadi, Uganda. She is hopeful of growing her businesses due to the fact that she is hardworking. Despite being challenged by price fluctuations, Jesca is requesting a loan to buy alcohol for selling. She is a member of Buseesa Farmers Group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy alcohol for selling.

loans.name: Fidelia Mariela

texts.es: Hace cuatro años que Fidelia tiene su propio negocio de pulpería. A sus 30 años de edad ha logrado salir adelante y mantener a su pequeño hijo. Este es el tercer préstamo que obtiene a través de MiCrédito, los que ha obtenido anteriormente le ha ayudado a aumentar su inventario y suplir la demanda de sus clientes mejorando así sus ingresos. Solicita el crédito para comprar Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Aceite, Huevos entre otros. De esta manera lograra mantener su pulpería estable.
texts.en:
Fidelia has had her own grocery store for four years. At 30 years old, she has managed to get ahead and provide for her small son. 

This will be her third loan with MiCrédito [My Loan]. The loans which she previously took out have helped her to increase her inventory and meet the demands of her customers, improving her income as a result.

She is requesting this loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, and eggs among other things. This way, she will manage to keep her grocery store running smoothly.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, and eggs among other things.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 39 years old and has six children. Evelyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Evelyn is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,500 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sabelita

texts.en:
Sabelita sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional toys, accessories and other products which are needed to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for the educational expenses of her children and pay for their daily needs.

Sabelita is very positive that she can improve more her business if you will lend her an amount of 10,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward additional supplies of toys, accessories and other products needed in her businesses. Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result for her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family.

Sabelita dreams of becoming a successful entrepreneur someday. She also hopes to give her children's needs, particularly for their education, so that they will be able to complete their studies and then find a stable job in the future. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Yeraldin

texts.es:
Yeraldin una joven que inicio su negocio de Zapatería por necesidad económica, aprendió de su padre por lo que mantiene viva una tradición que venía siendo desarrollada por hombres, hasta que llego Yeraldin a darle un toque femenino.
Es la orgullosa madre de una hija de tan solo un año de edad y pro ella es que trabaja con más empeño para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ofreciéndolo un hogar acogedor y que tenga todo a la mano pues su mayor preocupación y temor es que su hija llegue a pasar por una necesidad. 
Solicita formalmente un préstamo para la compra de 	de una máquina de codo e insumos como cuero, pegantes, cintas, hebillas para la elaboración de zapatos que posteriormente vende en una vitrina.
texts.en:
Yeraldin is a young woman who started her cobbler business out of economic necessity.  She learned it from her father, so she is keeping alive a tradition that was carried out by men until she came along to give it a feminine touch.  

She is the proud mother of a little girl who is just one year old. It is for her that she works hard each day, in order to improve her living conditions and give her a comfortable home with everything at hand, as her major preoccupation and fear is that her daughter might go without.  

She is formally requesting a loan for the purchase of a an industrial sewing machine and supplies such as leather, adhesive, tape, and buckles for making shoes that she later displays and sells.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as leather, adhesive, tape, and buckles for making shoes.

loans.name: Edwin Andres

texts.es: Andres es un joven muy alegre que vive con sus padres y se dedican  a la agricultura y ganadería, Andres trabaja al jornal y también hace sus pequeños huertos de papas, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono, fungicidas y mano de obra para tener sus cultivos sanos y asi obtener una buena cosecha, Andres desea seguir trabajando y para progresar diariamente y en algun momento comprarse un lotecito para sembrar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Andres is a very cheerful young man who lives with his parents and is engaged in agriculture and livestock-raising. Andres works as a day laborer and also grows potatoes on small plots. 

He is going to use the loan to purchase manure, fungicides and labor so that he can keep his crops healthy and this way have a good harvest. Andres wishes to continue working and progressing every day and to at some point buy a small piece of land for growing his crops.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Telma

texts.en:
This is Telma. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly entrenched her business. She was able to purchase additional stocks of LPG tanks she needs to increase her product inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs.

Telma is very positive that she can improve more her business if you will lend her an amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go toward additional stocks of tanks of LPG. Her customers will likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also make her business become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Telma aims to send her children to college. She is pretty sure that if she gives the best for her children's education, their lives will become more improved and successful. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy LPG

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Mantu, Ladi and Jamila.  Before he became a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Ibrahim spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Rokia

texts.en:
Rokia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell egg business in the Philippines.

Rokia requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase more trays of eggs to sell. She has been in this business for 9 years now.

In the future, Rokia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: buy eggs

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.  Mary Jane requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 8 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Cospa Group

texts.es: María, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo y reside en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira junto a tres de sus hijos. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos, y hace 8 años ha cultivado café, el cual vende en pergamino la misma zona. Esta solicitando un segundo prestamo en forma grupal por 6,000 Lempiras, para comprar fertilizante, abono y pago de mano de obra por limpieza de la finca de café. Su propósito es crecer con este cultivo y llegar a ser una productora grande de café para ayudar a sus hijos con buena educación. El grupo se llama Cospa, que esta integrado por cuatro miembros que también se dedican a la agricultura, viven en la misma zona y el préstamo lo invertirán en la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de café. El préstamo grupal es por 20,000 lempiras. En la foto esta María a la Izquierda, seguido esta doña Catalina, Prudencio y a la derecha Isidra.
texts.en:
María, 31, lives in a common-law relationship with her husband in a village in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira, along with her three of her children.

She has always worked in agriculture growing basic grains.  For eight years she has grown coffee, which she sells in parchment in the same area.

She's requesting a second loan for 6,000 lempiras [HNL] as part of a group.  She's going to buy fertilizer and soil amendments and pay for labor to weed the coffee farm.  Her goal is to expand with this crop and become a large-scale producer of coffee so she can help her children with a good education.

The group is called Cospa, and it's made up of four members who also work in agriculture.  They live in the same area and are investing the loan in fertilizer for growing coffee.  The group loan is for 20,000 lempiras [HNL].

María's at the left in the photo; next to her are Catalina, Prudencio, and, at the right, Isidra.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and soil amendments and to pay for labor to weed the coffee farm

loans.name: Redalyn

texts.en:
Redalyn is a 23-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

Redalyn requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell..  She has been in this business for 8 years. 

In the future, Redalyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en: Sina, 57, is a mother of one child living in Kampong Cham province. She earns income to support her family by farming rice. She has been in this business for ages and earns about 38,900 KHR per day. For Sina, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Tin's Group

texts.en: Tin is 52 years old and a father of seven children. He lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He grows rice as a main source of income. This is Tin's first loan request with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and he is leading a group of two members to get the new loan. As the group leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed and pay for plowing fees. He hopes that he can improve the living condition of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed and pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sokoeun's Group

texts.en: Sokoeun’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. Sokoeun works as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: buy a water filter

loans.name: Kongkea's Group

texts.en:
Kongkea’s Group lives in a rural village in Phnom Penh city, in Cambodia. 

Kongkea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and a doctor to support her family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: José

texts.en:
José decided to invest in his biodigester to take advantage of the manure his cows and rabbits produce to obtain his own renewable energy: biogas. Inputting his animals' waste into the system will start the natural methanisation process, producing biogas, and create bacteria that will transform the waste into a nutrient-rich organic fertilizer. 

José will drastically reduce his operating expenses as he displaces LP gas and chemical fertilizers, while avoiding unnecessary greenhouse gas emissions due to his usage of fossil fuels and the fact that he was piling up the waste right outside the farm, also contaminating underground water sources and attracting flies. 

His wife will be able to cook with biogas, replacing the wood she used in the past and whose toxic smoke she was inhaling on a daily basis. The savings he will make will allow José to continue caring for his animals and potentially expand his activity by purchasing more livestock. 

This loan represents 6% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
El señor Rufino de 54 años de edad, es padre de  3  hijos es propietaria de una venta de ropa ubicada en el mercado de la Roosevelt que el administra tiene 17 años de tenerla cuando él empezó con sus ventas tenía mucha competencia pero la gente fue viendo sus ofertas y productos y salió adelante vendiendo mas y sacando más ganancias. La historia que el cuenta tiene sueños y metas muy grandes para tener mejor a sus hijos.
En Esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa nueva para la venta.
texts.en:
Rufino is 54 years old and the father of three children. He owns a clothing stand at the Roosevelt market, which he has been running for 17 years. When he started selling he had a great deal of competition but people started to see his selection and products and he succeeded in selling more and earning. more profit. The story he tells has dreams and great goals for doing the best for his children. 

On this occasion he is requesting this loan so that he can buy new clothing for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothing for re-sale.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 23 años y ya se recibió de Ingeniero Ambiental, y su meta es poder enseñar en las Facultades; es por eso que esta estudiando didáctica universitaria. Su aspiración es poder trabajar en una empresa multinacional, y así poder brindarle una vida mejor a sus padres que están en el interior del país,y a la vez poder tener una vida tranquila.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su curso, y de esa forma estudiar esta importante especialización.
texts.en:
Javier is 23 years old and has already graduated as an Environmental Engineer. His goal is to be able to teach college-level courses, and so he is studying university education.

His aspiration is to be able to work for a multinational company, in order to be able to give his parents who live in Paraguay a better life, as well as have a calm life for himself. 

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay for course fees to study this important specialization.

loans.use: to pay for course fees.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 46-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Evelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 10 years.

Evelyn is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Judeth

texts.en:
Judeth is a 45-year-old married woman. She and her husband have four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Judeth has a food vending business in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 10 years.

Judeth is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Judeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Liway

texts.en:
Liway is a 23-year-old married woman. She and her husband have three children, one of whom is in school.

Liway is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Specifically, she raises pigs to earn a living. She explains that she has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Liway is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Liway would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Samaila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Toma, Gabriel and Dina. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Samaila would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Samaila can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Samaila spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 46-year-old married woman. She and her husband have eight children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lolita has a buy-and-sell copra business in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 20 years.

Lolita is requesting a loan in the amount of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of copra to sell. In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of copra to sell

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru:
Гавхару 45 лет, она проживает в городке под названием Нурек. У Гавхар одна единственная дочка, которой 26 лет. Для нее дочь является самым близким человеком на земле. Она является смыслом жизни и мотивацией для продолжения жизни и продвижения вперед. 
  Гавхар в течение 6 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды в национальном стиле. Гавхар также на некоторых платьях сама делает вышивки. В месяц она может сшить даже 25 платья. Гавхар прекрасно справляется со своей работой и количество клиентов постепенно возрастают. Гавхар обратилась за кредитом, потому что ей необходимо поменять швейную машинку, потому она уже не рабочем состояние и прослужила очень долгое время. Новая швейная машинка стоит дорого, чтобы ее купить Гавхару потребуется еще не большое количество денег. Она решила собрать не достающую сумму денег за счет кредита.
texts.en: Gavhar is 45 years old and lives in a town called Nurek. Gavhar has one daughter, who is 26 years old. For Gavhar, her daughter is the closest person on Earth. She is the purpose of life and motivation for continuing to live and moving forward. Gavhar has been involved in sewing women's national-style clothing for 6 years. Gavhar also makes embroideries on several dresses. She can sew as many as 25 dresses in one month. Gavhar beautifully handles her work, and the number of her clients has been gradually increasing. Gavhar requested this loan because she needs to replace her current sewing machine that is no longer in a working order and had served her for a very long time. The new sewing machine is expensive, and Gavhar is short a small amount of money to purchase it. She decided to obtain the remaining amount as a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new "Janome" sewing machine

loans.name: Luis Aberto

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de materiales de dentales,el socio por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales dentales.El socio solicita el credito para comprar amalgamas  y resinas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is continuing his business of selling dental materials. Through this business the member wants to succeed in life. His dream is to expand his business selling dental materials and he is requesting a loan in order to buy dental alloys and resins. 

The member is happy about the loan and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: To purchase dental alloys and resins.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old and is married with four children. With three children in school, Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items.

Maria is requesting a loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, rice, shampoo, and other groceries. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell (e.g., canned goods, rice, and shampoo)

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 38 years old and has two children who are in school. As a result, Monica works very hard to provide for them.

Monica runs a general store in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 15 years now.

Monica is requesting a loan in the amount of 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, shampoo, and coffee. In the future, Monica would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell (e.g., canned goods, shampoo, and coffee)

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

To earn a living, she buys and sells processed foods in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from fish vending. She explains that she has been sustaining her business activities through two prior loans from NWTF.

Rowena is seeking to borrow a new loan, this time in the amount of 15,000 PHP, through NWTF to buy additional stocks of processed food to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of processed food to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 37-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has two children. 

Helen operates a small sari-sari, or retail store, business selling various goods and food items to the people in her area. Helen's business is very productive. 

As of now, she wants to expand her store in order for her to cater to more buyers and customers. Helen is asking to take a loan to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and other toiletries, biscuits, bread, rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, condiments, and others. With the loan, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Helen dreams of making her business more stable and productive. Furthermore, she wants to save some money to pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and other toiletries, biscuits, bread, rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, condiments, and others

loans.name: Raul Wenchell

texts.en:
Raul Wenchell is a fish vendor from Trinidad, Bohol. He is 37 years old, married, and has two children. 

Raul Wenchell has been in the fish vending business for more than 4 years now. He is sitting next to buckets of fish for selling. 

Raul Wenchell is asking to take a loan to buy more fish to sell to his customers. A loan will help his fish stock to sell.

In the future, Raul Wenchell hopes to make his fish vending business a success. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies that are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow an amount of 45,000 PHP again. This new loan will go to additional fish and vegetables, which she sells. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance. She also operates a direct-selling business, and she is also now selling fruit for additional profit.

Brenda wants her business to continuously flourish and grow. She wants to give her family a better life in the future. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fish

loans.name: Veth's Group

texts.en: Veth, 43, is a farmer in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia and a mother of four children. To support her family, she earns income by growing cassava and rice. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 34,700 KHR per day. For Veth, this is her third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide and pay for laborers. She hopes she can get more yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for laborers.

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en:
Phoeun’s group live in a rural village in Phnom Penh city in Cambodia. 

Phoeun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as iron repairer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a 40-year-old married woman. She and her husband have six children. With two children in school, Thelma works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 3 years now.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, including canned goods, eggs, and coffee. In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell (e.g., canned goods, eggs, and coffee)

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 56 years old and is married with six children. Antonia works very hard to provide for them.

Antonia runs a general store in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 2 years.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell, including coffee, milk, candies, and other groceries. In the future, Antonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell (e.g., coffee, milk, candies, and other groceries)

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de madera,el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sucño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de madera.El socio solicita el credito para comprar madera.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carlos continues to sell wood for a living and he wants to be successful by means of this business. His dream is to expand his wood-selling business, so he is requesting a loan to buy wood. 

Carlos is happy about the loan and he promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Lady Lou

texts.en:
