Lady Lou is a hardworking mother from Mcarthur, Leyte. She is a 39-year-old married woman with four children. Three of her children are still attending school.

To earn a living, she works as a meat vendor. She sells meat inside the market located in her community. She has been engaged in meat vending business for more than 20 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of meat and to pay labor costs. Her business has been running smoothly, so these additional stocks would be very helpful in augmenting her daily income. Lady Lou now earns more income than usual, which allows her to repay her loan and to cover household expenses. In addition, she can continue to send her children to school for a brighter tomorrow. She is determined to manage her money properly to achieve her dreams in life, to have a happy family, and to have a sustainable livelihood in the coming future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of meat and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason sends you his thanks for your generosity because his previous loan has enriched his business. He was able to buy spare parts and supplies and to pay for the maintenance of his computer units. The loan also helped him to provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

He is very positive that he can improve his business even more if you will let him borrow again the amount of 50,000 PHP. This new loan will go to supplies he needs in his shop and also to buy additional computer units he needs to improve his service and profit. Simultaneously, he can sustain the needs of his family through the help of this assistance.

Jason hopes to grow and expand soon. He desires to have a better life and a stable source of income to sustain their everyday needs. He meets every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional computers, spare parts, and supplies.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is a food vendor from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 49 years old and married and she has five grown children. 

Merilyn sells home cooked foods and snacks to the people in her neighborhood. Merilyn has been in this business for more than 20 years now. 

Merilyn is requesting to take a loan to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, sugar, milk, and flavorings. This loan will enable her to cook and sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Merilyn hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, sugar, milk, and flavorings

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio como actividades económicas principales.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como gallos, pollos, gallinas, pavos, patos, cerdos, entre otros, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con clientes fijos en la zona quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y comerciales de el. El préstamo será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales para su negocio así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos, dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender los diversos gustos y preferencias de sus clientes lo que le generará mayores niveles de ingresos y aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys is 28 years old and lives with her partner. She lives with her family in a rural area of Cayaltí district, in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru's north coast. Life in this area is quiet. People make a living principally in farming, livestock-raising, and in running small businesses.

She raises and sells animals such as chickens, turkeys, ducks, pigs and other animals. She has more than five years experience in the business which is located at her home. She has steady customers in the area who provide her with very good personal and work references. 

The loan will be used to purchase more animals for her business as well as for the purchase of balanced feed for fattening him. This investment will help her to increase her stock of animals so that she can serve the various tastes and preferences of her customers. This will generate greater income for her, and improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more animals for her business, as well as for the purchase of balanced feed for fattening them.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She explains that she has been sustaining her business activities through 5 prior loans from NWTF.

Erlinda is now seeing to borrow a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetable to sell for her vegetable vending business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of vegetable to sell

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y su hija en casa propia en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. Las actividades económicas principales que se desarrollan en el distrito son la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica al comercio de arroz, compra arroz en cáscara y vende el arroz ya procesado (pilado), cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de arroz para incrementar el stock de su negocio con lo que espera aumentar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcos is 47 years old and lives with his partner and daughter in his own house in the district of Pucará, Jaén province, in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The main economic activities in the district are agriculture, ranching, and commerce. 

Marcos works in the sale of rice. He purchases rice in the hull, and sells it after processing it (removing the hull). He has more than five years of experience doing this work, and has very good personal and professional references in the area. The loan will be used to purchase a larger quantity of rice to increase his stock, with which he hopes to increase his income and therefore improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity rice to increase his business's stocks.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 38-year-old married woman with four children. With three children in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a general store in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 4 years.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell, including eggs, canned goods, and beverages. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell (e.g., eggs, canned goods, and beverages)

loans.name: Gloria Stella

texts.es:
Una cafetería represento para Gloria la oportunidad de salir delante, de generar sus propios recursos, de no depender de su esposos para comer un bocado o incluso para vestir alguna prenda pues ella desde el año 2012 tuvo el atrevimiento de buscar su propio horizonte.
Gloria es la madre de 2 hijos de 11 y 16 años de edad y gracias a su profesión puede generar ingresos para que ellos puedan estudiar y disfrutar de una comida digna.
Gloria solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de surtido en general, desde insumos de alimentos, café, bebidas para abastecer su negocio.
Con tu apoyo Gloria puede mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes, diversificar su oferta a los clientes.
texts.en:
A cafe  represented for Gloria for the chance to succeed in generating her own resources, and to not depend on her husband for her daily food and clothing.


Since 2012 she has dared to seek her own horizon. Gloria is the mother of two children, ages 11 and 16 and thanks to her occupation she can generate income so that they can go to school and enjoy a decent diet.  Gloria is requesting a loan so that she can buy stock in general, such as food supplies, coffee and drinks for stocking her business.  

With your support Gloria can improve her sales, increase her  clientele and diversify her selection for customers.

loans.use: To buy a stock of coffee, foodstuffs and drinks so that she can supply her business.

loans.name: Rhodena

texts.en:
Rhodena is a 36-year-old single woman. Rhodena works hard to provide for herself and her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from fish vending. Rhodena explains that she has borrowed and repaid 5 prior loans from NWTF.

She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell, including canned goods, beverages, and other groceries. Rhodena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional items (e.g., canned goods, beverages, and other groceries)

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan pablo es un comerciante casero, el cual tiene una vitrina ubicada en su hogar donde oferta productos de uso y aseo personal, esta actividad ha ayudado para que pueda solventar sus necesidades económicas y cubrir sus necesidades básicas. 
Entre sus necesidades esta aumentar y diversificar su surtido pues muchas personas optan por estas actividades ante la falta de oportunidades de empleo por ello necesita de urgencia un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía, productos de aseo y calzado.
Un apoyo puede ayudar a este hombre a seguir en pie su empresa y tratar de mejorarla y ampliarla en un futuro.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo is a home-based merchant. He has a display case in his home where he provides personal products and hygiene products. This business has helped him to be able to cover his economic and basic needs.
Among his needs, he needs to increase and diversity his stock. Many people have this kind of business because of the lack of employment opportunities, so he urgently needs a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise: personal products and shoes.
Support can help this man to keep going with his business and to try to expand and improve it in the future.

loans.use: to buy personal products and shoes.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara es una humilde  mujer cabeza de familia que de momento se encuentra sin empleo y lo más preocupante es que ella tiene 3 hijos, conseguir capital de trabajo en verdad se ha vuelto una necesidad y por ello va a recurrir al emprendimiento con la esperanza de que este proyecto se vuelva una manera sostenible de mantener a su familia en el tiempo. 
Con la ayuda de un crédito iniciara su negocio de tienda general comprando primeramente: Refrescos, cervezas, dulces y productos de primera necesidad.
Apoya a esta luchadora mujer que solo quiere el bien de sus hijos y sostener su familia.
texts.en:
Clara is a humble woman. She is the head of her family and is currently unemployed. The most concerning part of this is that she has three children. Getting working capital has truly become a necessity, so she is turning to loans with the hope that this project will develop sustainably so that she can support her family in time.
With the help of this loan, she will start her general store. She will mainly buy pop, beer, sweets, and basic staples.
Support this fighter. She only wants the best for her children, and to support her family.

loans.use: to start her general store: to buy pop, beer, sweets, and basic staples.

loans.name: Fourou Tono2 Group

texts.fr: Jacqueline est la responsable de ce groupe de 5 membres. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Pour aider son époux qui est chauffeur à faire face au dépenses de leur famille et assurer un avenir à leurs enfants, cette brave dame fait le commerce du charbon de bois. Elle a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de charbon stocker pour vendre. les bénéfices que ses ventes généront lui permettront de s'occuper de sa famille et de renforcer son commerce.
texts.en: Jacqueline is the leader of this group composed of five members. Jacqueline is married and has four children, all in school. In order to help her husband, who works as a driver, to support the family and secure a future for their children, this resilient woman sells charcoal. She needs a loan in order to stock up on bags of charcoal for resale. Her revenues will allow her to take care of her family and bolster her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 59-year-old married woman with six children. With one child in school, Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for 2 years now.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell, including candies, eggs, and canned goods. In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell (e.g., candies, eggs, and canned goods)

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 35 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Analiza runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and groceries. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, soft drinks, candies, school supplies, and other groceries. 

In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and groceries

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 56 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, ketchup, canned goods, beverages, and groceries. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, matches, soap, coffee, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, ketchup, canned goods, beverages, and groceries

loans.name: Elva

texts.en:
Elva is 42 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Elva runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, shampoo, beverages, and groceries. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as beverages, toothpaste, coffee, and toiletries.

In the future, Elva would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, shampoo, beverages, and groceries

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel is 45 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarette, and beverages.

Ethel has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Ethel aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarette, and beverages

loans.name: Tweimukye Kitonya Farmers Group

texts.en: Yosam lives in Kagadi Uganda and is married with 3 children. To earn an income, he has sold local brew since 2011 and does farming. He desires to have a big, financially sound, and stable business, though he is faced with price fluctuations that hinder his returns. Yosam is asking for credit to buy local brew to sell ahead of the Christmas season. He is a member of Tweimukye Kitonya Farmers Group, where the members guarantee each other's loans, since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell ahead of the festive season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dyes, treatments, and hair straighteners.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es un hombre de 41 años de edad, casado, tiene 4 hijos de 18, 16, 14 y años, y su negocio es la pesca.
Él es buen padre, generoso, amable, independiente, activo, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Patapatani’ caracterizado por su cercanía al lago sagrado Titicaca, área agrícola dónde se cría ganado; vacuno, ovino y camélido, se vive de la pesca y también de vegetales del lugar, como la quinua, el chuño, la haba, la papa, etc. de clima frío, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 1-12 grados centígrados y donde los rayos solares golpean con mucha fuerza la superficie.
Alejandro es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y también habla español. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y con su esposa que se dedica a la agricultura. Su negocio es la pesca, las variedades más comunes, son; el Karachi, ispi, pejerrey y mauri. Trabajo que lo realiza de manera independiente todos los días de la semana. “la pesca es un trabajo que herede de mi familia, ya llevo 25 años en este trabajo…” comenta. Su herramienta de trabajo de mayor uso son las redes de pesca, y estas se averían constantemente. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener más botes de pesca. El desea realizar la compra de redes por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 25 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Alejandro solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pesca por mayor para pescar continuamente.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a 41-year-old man. He is married with 4 children ages 18, 16, and 14. He is a fisherman.
He is a good father, generous, kind, independent, active, responsible, and hard-working. He works in the Patapatani community, which is known for being close to the sacred Lake Titicaca. This is an agricultural area where the people raise livestock (cows, sheep, and llamas). The people live off of fishing and local vegetables including quinoa, chuño, beans, potatoes, etc. The climate is cold, with a temperature that varies during the day from 1-12 degrees Celsius. The sun's rays are very harsh.
Alejandro is dark-skinned, of medium height, and has short black hair. His mother tongue is Aymara, which is spoken locally. He also speaks Spanish. He shares his life with his children, who are in school, and with his wife, who is a farmer. Alejandro is a fisherman and fishes the most common varieties, which are: karachi, ispi, pejerrey and mauri. He works independently every day of the week.
"Fishing is a job that I inherited from my family. I have been doing this work for 25 years now" he says. His most-used work tools are his fishing nets, and these are constantly falling apart. His dream is to expand his business and have more fishing boats. He wants to purchase nets wholesale. This is his first loan sequence with the institution in the 25 years he has been doing this work independently.
For these reasons, Alejandro is requesting a loan for the wholesale purchase of fishing nets in order to keep fishing.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets wholesale in order to keep fishing.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 45 years old and married with six children. She lives in Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. 

For the past two years, Edwina has been a farmer. She earns 2,000 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC. 

Edwina is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. 

In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is a businesswoman from Pagadian. She is 59 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Antonieta is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

Antonieta continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 64 años de edad, es viuda, vive en casa propia junto a su hija en el distrito de Querecotillo, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad Catimor, tiene 15 años de experiencia en esta actividad y cuenta con clientes fijos en la zona quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su cultivo, así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Esta inversión lo ayudará a mejorar la calidad de su cultivo mejorando su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Cristina is 64 old and a widow. She lives in her own home with her daughter in Querecotillo district, in Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in Peru's northern highlands.  Life in this area is quiet. People make a living principally in farming, livestock-raising, and in running small businesses.

She grows Catimor coffee (an Arabica coffee bean varietal) and has been in this business for 15 years. She has steady customers in the area who provide her with very good personal and work references. 

She will use the loan in order to purchase manures and fertilizers for maintaining her crop, as well as for hiring labor for the harvest season. This investment will help her improve the quality of her crop; improving her level of income and therefore her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To purchase manures and fertilizers for maintaining her crop, as well as for hiring labor for the harvest season.

loans.name: Hanne Isiyaku

texts.en: Hanne Isiyaku is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hanne Isiyaku joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Elisha, Laraba and Bilkisu. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hanne Isiyaku would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hanne Isiyaku can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Hanne Isiyaku spoke of her ambition to use the additional income to educate her children, eventually hoping to ensure her children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school fees and uniforms, eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 52 years old and married with eight children. With four children in school, Lorna works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, shampoo, and canned goods. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as toothpaste, milk, coffee, vinegar, soy sauce, and cosmetics.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, shampoo, and canned goods

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy grocery items and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve her business even more if you will let her borrow again the amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional groceries, toiletries, and beverages she needs to expand her product inventory. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Edna wants to expand her business soon. She also hopes that her children will be able to find jobs that are the right fit for them. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize and cassava flour for selling

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Violeta works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling bamboo mats in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bamboo to make bamboo mats for her business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional bamboo to make bamboo mats

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 57 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Saturnina is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other spare parts for the maintenance of her farm machinery.

Saturnina has been farming rice for 42 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice grains and rice.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer as well as spare parts for the maintenance of her farm machinery

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Liezel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling live fish. Liezel is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net for her fishing business.

Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net for her business

loans.name: Gulafzo

texts.ru:
Гулафзо в настоящий момент является студенткой. Ей 24 года. Она учится на шестом курсе Таджикского Медицинского Университета имени Абуали ибн Сина в общемедицинском факультете. Гулафзо будущий врач, она сейчас со всей серьезностью относится к учебе, так как хочет стать хорошим профессиональным врачом.
Гулафзо живет с родителями в районе Дж. Руми. Ее мать занимается выращиванием скотов, а отец работает трудовым мигрантом в России. Семья Гулфазо еще не оплатила ее учебный контракт за этот год. Они нуждаются в 1000 долларах США. Из-за неимения финансовой возможности, Гулафзо просит необходимую сумму в кредит. Она хочет успешно окончить ВУЗ и надеется, что вы ее поддержете.
texts.en:
Gulafzo is currently a student. She is 24 years old. She is studying medicine in her sixth year at Abu Ali Ibn Sina Tajik Medical University. Gulafzo is a future doctor. She studies very seriously because she wants to become a good doctor.

Gulafzo lives with her parents in J. Rumi. Her mother is raises livestock and her father is a migrant worker in Russia. Gulfazo's family has not paid her tuition yet. They need $1,000. Because she doesn't have the money, Gulafzo needs to ask for a loan. She wants successfully complete her university degree and hopes that you will support her.

loans.use: pay tuition in medical school.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора молодая девушка в возрасте 22 лет. Она живет в селе района Джиликуль с отцом, старшей сестрой и ее двумя детьми. Гулнора работает учительницей в школе и еще занимается шитьем. Ее семья занимается растениеводством и она помогает им в работе на земле. У них имеется 1 га участка орошаемой земли, на котором они сеют зерновые и огородные культуры. Целью кредита является сельскохозяйственная деятельность. Гулнора на сумму кредита хочет купить семена пшеницы и минеральные удобрения, чтобы провести сезонный посев. Этот кредит важен их семье для продолжения деятельности. В канун Рождества они верят в чудо и в доброту людей.
texts.en: Gulnora is a young girl, 22 years old. She lives in a village in Jilikul with her father, older sister and her two children. Gulnora works as a school teacher and takes in sewing. Her family farms, and she helps. They have a one-hectare plot of irrigated land where they grow grain and vegetables. This loan is for agriculture. Gulnora would like to use the loan to buy wheat seed and fertilizer for planting. This loan is important to continue the family business. On Christmas Eve they believe in miracles and in the goodness of people.

loans.use: buy wheat seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 48 years old and has one child in school.

Elizabeth has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business, which she has been in for 10 years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Myrna works hard to support her family. She has an electrical and break bonding shop in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Myrna is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials like wires for her business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like wires for her business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a widowed woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 68 years old now.

Elena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Elena has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 38 years old with two children. With one child in school, Nimfa works very hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, and groceries. Nimfa has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, beverages, snack food, and other groceries. 

In the future, Nimfa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, eggs, and groceries

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 39 years old and has three children. Two of her children are in school.

Remedios is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Remedios has been in this business for one year now and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ricafe

texts.en:
Ricafe is 34 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ricafe runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, beverages, and groceries. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, juices, coffee, and other groceries. 

In the future, Ricafe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, beverages, and groceries

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 50 years old with five children. She works very hard to provide for them. 

Susan runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, beverages, and groceries. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as soap, beverages, snack foods, bread, noodles, toiletries and other groceries. 

In the future, Susan would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, canned goods, beverages, and groceries

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Cristina works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Cristina is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed business.

Cristina has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
As a married mother of 4 children, Pablita works hard to support her family.

Pablita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy nets and other fishing materials for her business.

Pablita has been sustaining her business activities with help from her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy nets and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a married mother with 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and 2 of her children are still in school.

Maria has a business selling food in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Maria has been running her business for 6 years. In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Abagambakamu Kyomukama Group

texts.en: Winfred, a married woman who is 45 years old, farms and sells local brew in Kagadi Uganda to pay for her children's education. She wants to grow her business and educate her children with the returns, despite the challenge of competitors limiting her profits. Winfred is requesting credit to buy waragi (local brew) to sell. She is a member of Abagambakamu Kyomukama, where each member guarantees the loans of the others, since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy waragi (local brew) to sell.

loans.name: Emalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Emalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Emalyn is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

Emalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru: Ее зовут Зебинисо. Ей 46 лет. Зебинисо проживает в городе Нурек. Она добрая и трудолюбивая женщина.  Зебинисо замужем и мать троих детей. У нее один сын и две дочери. Дочкам 16 и 14 лет. Сыну 10 лет. Ее муж работает строителем в городке Нурек. Зебинисо  более 5 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. Для нее время, проведенное за швейной машинкой, доставляет больше удовольствие. Ей удобно шить на дому. Ее нынешняя машинка не выполнят свои функции достаточно хорошо, как прежде. Зебинисо решила купить новую швейную машинки марки "Jamone", чтобы улучшить процесс работы. Также на оставшуюся часть денег она купить ткани для шитья. Зибинисо верит, что Вы сможете помочь ей купить новую швейную машинку, и она создать хорошие условия работы.
texts.en: Her name is Zebiniso. She is 46 years old. She lives in the town of Nurek. Zebiniso is a kind and hard-working person. She is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. Her daughters are 16 and 14 years old. Her son is ten years old.  Zebiniso's husband works in construction in the town of Nurek. For over five years, Zebiniso has been sewing women’s clothing. She enjoys the time spent at her sewing machine. It is convenient for her to work out of her home. Her current sewing machine no longer works as well as before. Zebiniso decided to buy a new sewing machine of the Jamone brand, in order to speed up her work. She will use the remainder of the funds to buy fabric for sewing. Zibiniso trusts that you will be able to help her buy a new sewing machine and improve her work conditions.

loans.use: to buy a Janome sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food products for making snacks

loans.name: Marigrace

texts.en:
Marigrace is thankful that she was granted a 20,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a Blessed New Year!

Marigrace dreams of having a bigger grocery store someday. She aims to give her children the best education until college for them to have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yarn and textiles for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used buy more fish, meat and vegetables to sell. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase more varieties of vegetables and fresh fish and meat needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Maria wants to give her family a better life someday. She knows that all her hard work in business will pay off. She meets every week with her *fellowship group to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for vegetables, fish, meat and other products to sell.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.ru: Хуршеда 22-летняя незамужняя молодая девушка, проживающая с родителями, двумя братьями и сестрой в районе Джиликуль. У нее высшее образование и она работает учительницей в сельской школе. Одновременно она вместе с родителями занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Она занята в этой деятельности уже 6 лет. Хуршеда помогает родителям в посеве и сборе урожая. Сейчас ее семья сажает очередной урожай. Чтобы приобрести необходимые семена пшеницы и минеральные удобрения, Хуршеда запрашивает  кредит, поскольку собственных средств не хватает. Их семья хочет вовремя провести зимний посев и поэтому надеется на вашу отзывчивость.
texts.en: Khursheda is a young, unmarried, 22-year-old girl who lives with her parents, two brothers, and a sister in Jilikul. She has a university degree and she works as a teacher in a rural school. At the same time she and her parents farm. She has been doing this work for six years. Khursheda helps her parents plant and harvest. Now her family is planting another crop. Khursheda is asking for a loan to get the necessary wheat seed and fertilizers because they do not have enough money. Their family wants to plant during the winter and are therefore hoping for your response.

loans.use: buy wheat seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is a married man with five children and is from Mcarthur, Leyte. His youngest child is 10 year old. He operates a motorcycle transport service. To augment his income, he also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic household commodities like sugar, eggs, powdered milk, biscuits, bread and soap. He has been engaged in this kind of business for almost ten years now.

Wilfredo has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy assorted groceries for the store like canned goods, noodles, beverages and toiletries. These  items are very helpful in attracting  more customers. In the long run, Wilfredo will be able to improve his sales and provide his children with proper diets.

In the future, he dreams of expanding his business to make it productive and profitable so that he can support the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries for his store, like canned goods, noodles, beverages and toiletries

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Orlando operates an internet cafe. He is a married man with a three-year-old child. He has been engaged in operating an internet cafe for five years now.

Because of scarcity of capital to continue his current business, Orlando is asking for a loan to purchase an additional set of computers. These will help him improve his income. He would be able to cater to more internet cafe users. In this way, he could earn more and set aside some savings to roll back into capital for any business ventures. 

He is determined that he will manage his internet cafe successfully to improve his standard of living and to support the needs of his growing child.

loans.use: to purchase an additional set of computers

loans.name: Felomena

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Felomena works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Felomena is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed business.

Felomena has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Junifer

texts.en:
Junifer is 31 years old and has one child.

Junifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, groceries, etc.

Junifer has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from seaweed.

Junifer aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ma. Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Ma. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

Ma. Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish pond. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Paulina works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Paulina is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

Paulina has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Felisa works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Felisa is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

Felisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana una mujer casada, ama de casa con un la responsabilidad de mantener un hijo, cuidarlo, pero esto la llevo a una depresión, no por el hijo, el sentirte sola ineficiente, sin un trabajo.
Gracias a una vecina que le recomendó que vendiera Perfumería, ha logrado llenar un vacío que tenía en su vida, con el negocio se siente muy feliz pues no descuida a su hijo que tiene tan solo 6 años de edad y puede salir incluso con él a visitar un amigo o amiga a ofrecerle sus productos.
Para la temporada de diciembre Diana solicita un préstamo para invertir en productos de perfumería para hombre y dama.
texts.en:
Diana is a married woman. She is a housewife and responsible for caring for her child. She became depressed not because of her child, but because she felt useless without a job.
Thanks to a neighbour who recommended that she sell perfume products, she has been able to fill a void in her life. She is very happy with her business; she is still able to care for her child, who is only 6 years old. She can take him with her to visit friends to sell her products.
For the December season, Diana is requesting a loan to invest in perfume products for men and women.

loans.use: to buy perfume.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rosita works hard to support her family.

She has a seaweed business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Rosita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production business.

Rosita has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy other farm supplies for her seaweed production

loans.name: Manikeswari Group

texts.en:
Pramila is the leader of a group that hails from Badadunguriguda village of Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 34 years. She has a small family comprising five members, including three daughters and one son. The member standing second from left in the front row with a yellow saree and raised hand is Pramila.

Pramila, with the help of her husband, has been doing a milk business for the last six years. At present, her monthly family income is about Rs. 7,000, but it is not sufficient to lead a better life.

So, she formed a self-help group with eleven other members of her locality and applied for a loan. It is the first-cycle loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of her business. From this loan, she will purchase a cow for the growth of her business.

Her future plan is to establish a processing unit for dairy products, as well as to provide higher education to her children.

The other members of the group also want a loan for the development of their existing businesses like – grocery shop, dairy, goatery, poultry, dry fish, hotel, carpentry, and vegetable vending.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is 60 years old, married, and has one child. She works very hard to provide for her family. 

Apolinaria runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She plans to buy items to sell such as canned goods, shampoo, beverages, groceries, etc.

Apolinaria has been running her general store for 4 years; she also earns some additional income from farming rice. She has already borrowed and successfully repaid 5 loans from NWTF. 

Apolinaria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, shampoo, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Muhayyo

texts.ru:
Мухайё профессиональный пекарь тортов и пирожных. Ей 37 лет. Она живет в городе Душанбе с двумя детьми, а муж в настоящее время находится на заработках за пределами страны. 
Мухайё занимается выпечкой на протяжении 5 лет и берет заказы у себя на дому. Сейчас она получила огромное количество заказов к Новому году. К сожалению у Мухайё не хватает средств, чтобы приобрести продукты для выпечки тортов. Она не хочет потерять клиентов и в связи с этим обратилась за кредитом. Мухайё верит и надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Muhayyo is a professional baker, making cakes and pastries. She is 37 years old. She lives in Dushanbe with her two children. Her husband is currently working abroad.

Muhayyo has been baking cakes for five years, and she takes custom orders from her home. She has received a huge number of orders for the New Year. Unfortunately, Muhayo does not have enough money to buy the supplies for cake baking. She does not want to lose customers and therefore requested a loan. Muhayo believes in and hopes for your help.

loans.use: buy ingredients to bake cakes.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 44 year old, married, and has 4 children. Her oldest is 16 years old and her youngest is 1 year old. She is engaged in raising and selling hogs, and she has been running her business for 8 years now. However, she also does some farming, which helps to augment her income. 

Jenny is requesting a loan in order to purchase some additional pigs, pig feed, and farming supplies such as fertilizer and pesticide. These tools are essential to not only the improvement of her hog raising business but also to raising the yield of her farm. 

With the improvement in her income, Jenny will now be able to both pay her household expenses and repay her loan. She will also be able to provide her family with good food and better shelter.

Jenny hopes that, in the future, this will be be the start of a successful path on the way to sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy some additional pigs, pig feed, and farming supplies such as fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is an 18-year-old single lady from Nablus city. She lives with her family in a humble house in the city. Her father and brother work as employees in a local firm where they get a low income. Amal is a student in a local university where she studies English literature. She wants to take the BA degree and find a job as a teacher in the future.

Amal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. This will help her to pay the urgent expenses she has now.

Amal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
Hazem, an 18-year-old single man from Gaza City, lives with his parents in a simple house. His father is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. 

Hazem is a university student studying Information Technology. He would like to earn the BA degree and find a job in the future to help his family.

Hazem took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will enable him to complete his assignments and reports easily. 

Hazem appears in the photo with his new laptop

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 21-year-old married lady from Nablus city. She lives with her husband in a simple house in the city. Her husband is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Sawsan is a university student where she studies social science. She would like to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to help her family with part of their expenses.

Sawsan took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her study. By taking this loan, Sawsan will be able to do her homework and write reports easily.

Sawsan appears in the photo with her new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study.

loans.name: Dúo Sololá Group

texts.es: Dúo Sololá El cual está integrado por el señor Nazario quien es propietario de una tienda ubicada en el interior del mercado de su localidad en el cual ya tiene 17 años de tener el mismo, él hace mucho tiempo se vino de su pueblo con la esperanza de crecer y prosperar aquí en la capital y menciona que gracias a DIOS le ha ido muy bien y es por ello que ha escuchado de la fundación y de los beneficios que otorga de la misma manera toca las puertas de FAPE para que se le otorgue un crédito el cual utilizara para la inversión de la misma tienda(compra de productos comestibles para vender por lo que agradece que se le tome en cuenta dicha solicitud
texts.en: Nazario is a member of Dúo Sololá. Nazario is the owner of a store which he has owned for 17 years, and it is located inside the market in his area. A long time ago, he came from his town with the hope of growing and prospering here in the capital, and he mentions thanks to GOD everything has gone well and that is why he heard about the foundation and the benefits that it gives. By the same token, he knocks on the doors of FAPE so that they can award him a loan which he will use to invest in his store (to buy groceries to sell for which he would appreciate that they take into account this request).

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Kabende Tukurakurane Group

texts.en: Denis is a member of Kabende Tukurakurane, where members guarantee each other's loans. He sells produce, has a retail shop, and farms. He faces the challenge of inadequate capital and challenges related to issues of seasonality. Besides that, he has hopes of expanding his business to new areas in order to serve many customers and generate more income. He will use the loan to buy posho, rice, and beans for selling

loans.use: to buy posho, rice, and beans for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more phone recharge cards which would widen his business.

loans.name: Phoem

texts.en: Phoem is a forty-nine-year-old widowed rice farmer. She lives with her four children in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She has been a farmer since 1979. Two of the children are road roller drivers and two are factory workers. Together, they can make around 25 USD daily. Due to the fact that her present house is old, Phoem would like to request a loan to buy lumber to renovate her house. This loan will provide her with a stronger house and better living conditions. In future, she is going to save money to buy farmland to cultivate rice.

loans.use: to buy lumber to renovate her house

loans.name: Bibioysha

texts.ru: Бибиойше 28 лет. Она молодая уроженка района Яван. Яван отличается своей необычной природой и приятной атмосферой от других мест Республики. У нее двое детей. Сыночку 3 года. Дочке 5 лет. Смысл жизни Бибиойши это ее дети. На районе она проживает вместе с мужем детьми и свекром. Именно от мужа и свекра Бибиойша научилась заниматься земледелием. Бибиойша уже более 5 лет продвигает растениеводческую деятельность. Сейчас она активно готовиться к посеву нового урожая. Она запланировала купить семена овощей, минеральных удобрений и горючее, но возникли финансовые затруднения, по которым она не смогла совершить покупку. Бибиойша обратилась за кредитом, чтобы собрать не достающую сумму денег, купить средства для посева и закончить посев урожая, чтобы на следующий сезон получить богатый и качественный урожай.
texts.en: Bibioysha is 28 years old. She is a young resident of the Yavan district. Yavan is known for its unique nature and pleasant climate as compared to other places in the Republic. Bibioysha has two children. Her son is 3 years old and daughter is 5 years old. Bibioysha's children provide a purpose for her life. She lives in her district with her husband, children and mother-in-law. Bibioysha learned farming from her husband and mother-in-law. Bibioysha has been running her agricultural business for over 5 years already. Now she is actively preparing for the sowing of the next crop. She planned to purchase vegetable seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel, but ran into financial difficulties, due to which she could not make this purchase. Bibioysha requested a loan to obtain the needed amount of money, buy the necessities for the sowing and finish planting her crop in order to gather a rich and quality harvest next season.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel in order to plant her crops

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is a 21-year-old single man from Nablus city in Palestine. He lives in a simple house in the city along with his parents and 4 brothers. His father is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. 

Murad is a university student who is studying information technology and communication. He would like to earn his Bachelor of Arts degree and then find a job to help his family with part of their expenses.

Murad took a USD Murabaha-type loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to pay the cost to attend his university for this semester. By taking this loan, Murad will be able to both complete his studies and pay some of his pressing expenses.

Murad appears in the photo above.

loans.use: to pay his university costs for this semester.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh is 64 years old and she is married with three children. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Oanh works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Oanh faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet. This is Oanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

In the future, Oanh hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Cường

texts.en:
Cường is 58 years old and she is married with four children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Cường works in agriculture farming food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Cường faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet. This is Cường's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Cường hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. He wants to buy a rickshaw so he can work transporting goods on it. This will enable him to improve his living conditions.

Ahmad has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw and start working. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to be independent and improve his living conditions. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food materials and resell them to enlarge her activity.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish.
Dung is 25 years old, and she is married with one child.
Dung lives with one dependent in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
This is Dung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Dung has been involved in her business for three years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.
In the future, Dung hopes for her children to do well in school and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La socia Mery se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de boletos turísticos a las diferentes personas del extranjero y también personas nacionales,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de boletos turisticos. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar boletos turísticos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Mery is continuing with her business selling tour tickets to foreign and national tourists. She is an enterprising woman and through this business wants to succeed in life. Her dream is to expand her business selling tour tickets. 

The member is requesting the loan in order to buy tour tickets. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy tour tickets to sell.

loans.name: Zoirjon

texts.ru: Зоирчону  45 лет . Он женат . У него большая семья. Работает Зоирчон поваром в чайхане.Чайхана в Таджикистане –это место где собирается старые и молодые чтобы за чашкой  чая пообщаться, обменяться новостями поделиться радостями и получить совет в  решении проблем.  Зоирчон любит свою работу так, как он  помогает людям украсить досуг и организовывает живое общение между  поколениями.  Его работа является основным источником дохода семьи. Хотя подросшие дети помогают отцу но так как он является главой семьи Зоирчсон делает все чтобы, создать комфорт  у себя в доме. Доход от чайханы не может в полной мере воплотить планы Зоирчона и поэтому для  текущего ремонта в доме и установки деревянных рам он хочет взять кредит.  По совету знакомых он обратился  в «Арванд»  Надеется , что при помощи «Арванд»  он сможет благоустроить свой дом. Зоирчон заранее благодарен в поддержке.
texts.en: Zoirjon is 45 years old. He is married. He has a big family. Zoirjon works as a cook in a tea house. Tea houses in Tajikistan are places where young and old go to have a cup of tea and talk, to exchange news, to share joy, and to get advice with problems. Zoirjon loves his job since he can help people with their leisure time and encourage communication between different generations. His work is the main source of income for the family. Though his grown children help, Zoirjon is the head of the family and therefore does everything he can to ensure his family's comfort. The income he earns from the tea house is not enough to follow through with his plans. Therefore, Zoirjon would like a loan to maintain his house and install wooden frames. On the advice of friends, he approached Arvand. He hopes that with Arvand's help, he will be able to renovate his home. Zoirjon thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: buy building materials.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
This is Mercy, 46, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, the Philippines. She is married to Ronnie, a driver.  She has one child who is still at the elementary level at school. She has had a food stall in a public market for ten years already. She works hard to augment the family income and provide for their everyday needs. 

Mercy buys meat, fish and vegetable products from a wholesaler and sells them in their town market. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. The town people prefer to buy at her stall for her fresh meat at reasonable price. She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

Mercy is requesting a Php 15,000 loan to purchase more fresh meat, more vegetables and stocks of processed meats, condiments and other grocery items to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

She hopes to expand her stall and someday operate her own supermarket. She aims to provide her child with the best education until college in order for her to have a better future.She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fresh and processed meat and add some grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
This is Bonifacia, 60, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jorge, her business partner. She manages her household while also operating the business. She works hard to provide, support and meet the family's daily, personal, household needs.

Bonifacia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5 amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns her income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 600 a day. 

To help her continue the operations of her general store business she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items and add fruit to sell at her small store. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Bonifacia hopes to maintain and grow her business so that she can have a better life and save for her old age.  She prays for good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and to add fruit for sale at her store.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is grateful that she was granted a PHP 30,000 loan which she used to buy raw ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables and condiments needed in her food stall business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like now to apply for PHP 55,000 which she will use to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings and frozen food products. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

She believes that all her hard work will bear fruit to improve their quality of living. She prays to have a baby soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery products, fish, fresh meat and processed foods for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Luisa. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had supported her business. She was able to buy spare parts and accessories for their vehicle. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she can improve her business more if you will let her borrow an amount of 16,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of accessories and spare parts of their vehicle. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family if the unit is regularly maintained and in good condition.

Ma. Luisa wants to have another vehicle so they can increase their profits. She desires for her family to always be happy and loving towards one another. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and the maintenance of their vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for textile, thread and other items needed for her sewing business.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Melba has been in this business for 22 years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bamboo weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase bamboo to make woven bamboo products for her business.

Elena has been in this business for 2 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo to make woven bamboo products

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 36 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a pre-paid mobile load business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional pre-paid mobile load to sell.

Marites has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the pre-paid mobile load for two years and also earns an income from stove making.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional pre-paid mobile load to sell

loans.name: Witethie Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Phillis; a member of Witeithie Self Help Group. She is married and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from trainings on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management. 

Her economic activity is potatoes and maize farming . She needs a loan from Kiva to boost her farming business by buying manure that will help improve on crop productivity. This will improve her harvest. She hopes this will increase her level of income so she can continue supporting her family by providing basic needs such as food and clothing.

Phillis is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy manure

loans.name: Soet Women Group

texts.en:
Pauline, raising her hand in the photograph, is a member of Soet Women Group. She is 44 years old, married and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from training in enterprise development and financial management. This has helped improve her knowledge in business management.

Her economic activity is maize and bean farming. She wants to expand her farming by starting green pea farming. This makes her borrow money to buy green pea seeds, manure and fertilizer. She hopes her farming will flourish, thus giving her a bountiful harvest. This will increase her level of income in order to continue supporting her family by providing food and clothing.

Pauline is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To buy seeds, manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Yeang's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Yeang is 44 years old and a mother of five children. She meets the needs of her family by cassava and rice growing. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn extra income. 

This is the first time for Yeang to request a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan on fertilizer and support for her farmland. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and support her farmland.

loans.name: Hta Lun Village Group

texts.en:
This community is located in Hta Lun Village, in Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy Delta region. In this community, there are five CBO (Community Based Organization) members overseeing a group of 27 village customers (10 Males, 17 Females). This loan will help the village customers purchase high quality feed ($27 per packet to feed 100 ducks for six days) and vitamins. 

Hta Lun Village has 245 households and over 800 people many of whom are farmers. The village also raises pigs, ducks and chickens as livestock for additional income. For education, this village has up to secondary level.  Older students travel to other towns to continue their education.

 The members pictured above are the four CBO members from Hta Lun Village: U Thein, U Than, U Kaw and Daw Khine. U Thein, a 36-year-old farmer, owns a two acre crop farm. He lives together with his wife and four children. His wife sometimes sells dry foods or vegetables by boat to villages. She and U Thein take care of their livestock, 200 ducks and two pigs. U Thein will use Proximity's loan to buy better quality feeds to increase eggs as well as income.

loans.use: to purchase high quality feeds and vitamins for ducks.

loans.name: Dúo Mely Group
